description: They have Powers Whiskey and a great selection of beer. Clean looking, great juke box, no dumb music, fair prices, and the bar tender is a super nice older Irish man with great customer service.  Bathrooms are kinda cramped and unisex- noticed when the bar got busier that some people really need to learn how to aim their piss and or practice respect for the facilities- but it is what it is/that's expected in a major city. That aside: great experience/nice spot.
author: JamesAndTeresa M.

description: how can you not love this place besides scumbags that stumble in.  as a staple 10 years ago it was great,  still kind of is......the "kinda is" part comes with SF in general and the changing of the time.   still my hometown bar even if the new bar tenders are arrogant hipsters
author: Mickrod S.

description:
Great value bar in the Haight.  The ambiance here is definitely similar to a Midwestern bar or one's you'll see out of movies like Roadhouse, minus the bar fights of course.

The place is definitely intimate and you get the sense that this is very much a local bar.  You'll often find locals here talking things up and sometimes couples swooning at the bar.  More importantly, they have jukebox filled with 60s-80s classics which can set the mood, moshing or romancing.  More importantly, drinks are cheap and always less than 10, unless of course you are buying for others.

Cash only though so bring it ready!
author: Joel Christian A.

description: Old bar that probably only cleans when they're renovating probably once every 30yrs. Nice smell of the street degenerates that just hang out in the back. crappy beer on tap because they probably haven't cleaned the taps in 30 years. Seriously, even trying every 10 years is better than this. That's not asking for too much
author: Sarim T.

description: This is a very divey bar, but the atmosphere here is guaranteed to be one of the best in the Haight. The female bartender that works here is very friendly with patrons and makes some fairly strong and well constructed drinks for prices that could easily rival other bars in the area. Seating is always plentiful at both the bar and table areas, and most seats are within clear view of the overhead televisions. In addition to partaking in stiff drinks, this is a great place to play a few games of pool or listen to some diverse music on the jukebox while you drink.
author: Joseph A.

description:
Usually when you think of drinks in Haight-Ashbury, you think Alembic or Zam Zam. But almost every single time I've been in the neighborhood I've ended up at Gold Cane. Doesn't hurt when the former are packed and there is always space at Gold Cane.

And it was only on this most recent trip did I learn they had a patio. Ugh...

Gold Cane is an affordable dive bar that offers some simple cocktails around $5, decent beer around $4, but the ambiance is where it is at. Filled with a friendly if eclectic mix of regulars and the occasional tourist group. Coincidentally I've usually taken friends out of town to here. With a solid bar, and a secondary room for sitting, pool, or pinball, it does offer a lot of space for groups or just finding a bar to sit at. Doesn't hurt they have some TVs to play some games. Even the bathroom situation is nice.

But on this most recent trip, the sliding doors to what I just thought was a backroom were open. Some extra space, some kegs, and a cool little bookshelf with books and even some VHS tapes. And then I saw it...

Gold Cane has a two level back patio. On the first level is a large, round table and a single bathroom. There was a jamband playing some music when we saw it. There are some stairs to the second level which has more tables or space to rest drinks. There is also a HUGE covered area behind this second level, but due to zoning or some kind of laws they can't actually have people go there. 

I'm a big fan of the Gold Cane, and looking forward to drinking more on the patio now that I know about it.
author: Michael C.

description: I love this place. The spot for locals to hang. The history here is pretty amazing being that its the oldest bar on the Haight.  And the staff is great. I have spent many many hours hanging out on the back patio here.
author: Ryan N.

description: I love this bar. Always drink specials, always super low key. A great dive bar in the Haight. Not much more to say, you should stop in!
author: Dave S.

description:
Bar with a martini as the logo. Doesn't serve martinis. 

You get your choice between a masshole bartender and an ogre who tries to disguise himself as a Cavs fan, which isn't much of a disguise, as that isn't a thing. 

Pro: Leonard
Con: Clay

Newly renovated bathroom, but the smell betrays the fact that the remodel is nothing more than putting lipstick on a pig. 

Having Martin Macks across the street is like being best friends with an ugly Chick in school to try and make yourself look less unattractive. 

Five stars cause they serve booze, which is quite literally a bar's sole purpose, so calm the hell down.
author: Daniel F.

description: The ambiance was cosy and the staff friendly, I'd stick with beer here though as the cocktails weren't that great.
author: Alison B.

description: The bartender is friendly and hooks it up. During the day on a weekday, the place has customers but isn't too loud, just how I like it. The music is a hit or miss, but that's a matter of taste. I prefer slow tunes.
author: Paulina F.

description:
I love this place! Very welcoming and friendly, the Gold Cane is a hidden gem in SF. 

Pros:
- THREE private stall bathrooms (men, women, outside). Excellent for the shy pooper. 
- Large two-tier back patio for smoking and/or catching a glimpse of the sun. Chill.
- Drinks are very reasonable. $4ish beers and $5ish cocktails. Lots of taps and a full bar. 
- Pool table and Addams Family pinball machine.
- The jukebox has a huge selection of music and people tend to choose music that makes a body feel good. 
- Book and media sharing shelf. 
- Friendly staff and patrons.
- Mostly locals, though it does get busy during any Haight-busy events.
- Lots of seating.
- Near both Buena Vista park and Golden Gate park. 

Cons:
- Cash only. There's an ATM with a $2.50 fee, which is better than I've encountered elsewhere. 
- Outside patio closes at 10pm during the week and midnight(?) on weekends. 
- Near Haight & Ashbury so parking sucks. Parking is either metered or restricted by the "J" parking permit. Avoid if possible.
- Internet/data service is spotty. 

The pros definitely outweigh the cons!
author: Heather W.

description: San Francisco has changed. The Gold Cane has not. Take this as high praise and settle in for a drink.
author: Finley O.

description: Eh... Nothing special. Service was slow even though it wasn't busy. Almost like we were bothering them by being there.
author: Sarah W.

description:
It's been awhile since my last review of the Gold Cane and thankfully my budding interest in Irish Car Bombs stopped years ago. My now preferred drink of choice is water... nothing beats getting super hydrated on a weekday night. 

I've always been a fan of the Gold Cane. The energy is always genuine and it's never too crowded. The scene is just easy.

Their outdoor patio is one of my favorite aspects about this place. It's nothing fancy - but being able to enjoy  fresh air and a robust full moon on a mellow night is a lovely thing on a weekday night in the Haight.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Nice staff. Decent price and selection on beer . The CD jukebox has a great selection. Social Distortion, Roy Orbison, Squeeze. The crowd was pleasant also. I'll be back.
author: John H.

description:
beautiful sunday afternoon. every bar in the upper haight was packed. and then we found gold cane, which was strangely empty. for no good reason.

it's a standard bar with an unkempt bartender who bartends like he should. in the back, we saw a group of old people comparing their medication and shake their pill cases really loud to compete with each other. it didn't stop there. they started shaking pill cases to the music. wow things got better.  is it a normal thing to do on a sunday afternoon? maybe. next review should help me answer this question. otherwise, it's a fun casual bar. one of the many on haight.
author: Te R.

description: Gold cane has nice outdoor seating and is frequented by many local musicians.
author: Owen C.

description: my favorite bar in the city. sf native so that means something, if you go and don't think it and the people are special you're missing out, shoutout to Mark, great bartender and all around good guy. feels like home here, and I'm not an alcoholic by any means
author: Chelsea V.

description: The Irish coffees are amazing, BUT they are ridiculously expensive for what you get AND be careful, because you may start twitching in your sleep!  You could also get it with decaf, which I would recommend strongly if it is late at night
author: Marco H.

description:
Three stars because the bartender is nice and funny, beer is cheap, enough room to seat, pool, and decent music. 
But it's still kind of a lousy bar (creeps everywhere) that I would not qualify as "a nice place". 

So yeah won't come back.
author: Sev G.

description:
When you just want a drink, maybe watch something, and sit down, the Gold Cane is there for you like that lady on your emergency numbers list when your mom forgets to pick you up.

It's been my reliable standby when wanting to watch a popular sporting event and Kezar and Martin Macks are packed. I almost got yelled at by my 49'er-loving pal one year because it was some end of season game and I made her late.We got a good standing spot at the Gold Cane and even made some new friends. 

Solid, reliable, and a great place to keep your friend from yelling at you.
author: Loli L.

description:
Oh my goodness, we had such a wonderful time here last night! This is my second trip to the area. I thought I had found my favorite bar on Haight Street the last time, but I was wrong. This bar is a bit of a dive, just the right place for avoiding crowds and relaxing after a busy day. Perfect spot to have a conversation and hang with friends without worrying about what you look like and if you will get service sometime in the next hour.

Drinks were cheap! The cheapest we have found here. They make the drinks stiff too, so you get your money's worth. The selection was great. We were able to watch a few different games on the TVs. 

I'm pretty easygoing, but the ladies' restroom gave me a moment's pause... There is a window directly next to the toilet that was frosted, but you can kind of tell if people are outside. That was odd, but after a couple of the aforementioned stiff drinks, who really cares?

Tip: like many places here, they are cash only. They have an ATM, though.

Our night was made by the bartender, Brandon. A nice, helpful guy who was attentive and friendly. Stop by to see him!

This place gets five stars because it was the highlight of my night. We will be back.
author: Amy R.

description: Fun inexpensive dive to hang out at on Haight Street. Never been or noticed it until I went tonight with a group from bocce ball. Beers are like $4. You can play pool for $1. There's only one table. It's a fun place to hang out at with a group.
author: Denise C.

description:
Pretty decent dive bar in the Haight. If you're looking to escape trendy and crowded bars and just want a place to sit down and enjoy a drink with your friends, Gold Cane is the right spot.

Beer selection on tap is fairly standard, with nothing you've never heard of before. The bartenders are friendly, but won't strike up a conversation with you. Pretty typical.

The great thing here is that the place is so large, finding seating is usually not a problem. If you can, grab a table by the window; makes for great people watching in one of SF's quirkiest districts. The furniture isn't too comfortable, but it gets the job done.
author: Dmitriy S.

description:
If you're looking for a dive bar, this place is great. If you're anticipating anything farther up the classiness ladder, keep looking.

Despite living in the Haight for 2+ years, I'd never even considered venturing foot across the threshold of what appears to be a very dark den of sketchiness. It's one of those spots on Haight St that I find myself actually stepping off the sidewalk to get farther away from as I walk by. I didn't ever even bother to glance at the name. So now you may be wondering, this sounds horrible and yet you rated it 4 stars?!

Last Saturday night, the boyfriend was browsing Yelp for a drink spot in the neighborhood. We just weren't in the mood for our usual haunts - The Alembic or Zam Zam. He noticed that there was a bar on Haight with a shocking 4-star rating that we'd never heard of. When I looked at the location, I knew it was one of those totally sketch-from-the-outside-pass-quckly-by spots (along with Trax). But I mean, I'm willing to try almost anything once. So over the Gold Cane we strolled. 

Highlights
- $4 draft beer (Blue Moon, Anchor Steam, etc)
- $3 draft beer (Coors, Bud, etc)
- $6 well drinks (Soco + Coke....it was a weird urge, don't ask)
- vintage jukebox - and some great classic rock tunes were playing that night
- friendly white-haired bartender who quite probably has been tending Gold Cane bar for nigh on 40 years

This is the type of bar where you'll find a contingent of neighborhood regulars taking shots of Jack, a few pool players, a lone ranger or two, and a table of random chicks who accidentally wandered in from the Marina. It's an interesting mix. Add to that the family portraits circa 1975 hanging behind the bar along with a "No Smoking" sign in Chinese, and honestly I'm sold. Next time I'm hankering for a cheap beer, I'll wander over to the Gold Cane.
author: Lindsey B.

description:
Had two pitchers of bud light and both did not taste good. 

Smells kind of weird but has a pool table which is dope. 

Only accepts cash so that's not good for your credit. 

But hey this is my first visit.
author: Shawn Y.

description:
The service at this place was terrible. The bartender barely attended us, and when he did he served what we asked but the second time he refused service on the fact that we didn't have California IDs but IDs from other states. He then decided to completely ignore us. 
Not a place I would recommend for anyone.
author: Maro I. L.

description:
The drinks are cheap but the bartender does not have a good attitude.

We walked in and looked for seating on the back patio. There was no seating but it looks cool out there so try for that it you can. 

We sat at the bar. The other patrons seemed cool. The bartender took our order and we got 2 beers. He was friendly an asked how we were. He seems cocky but I've partied in orange county and DTLA enough to NOT care. But then he poured his drinks with the spout away from him and then he started to pour a Guinness and walked away.

We had already had a round and tipped, but my boyfriend (a bar manager) stopped his Guinness tap about 3 mins into it's pouring. I'm an average joe and we were right in front of the tap and I was the one who told my bf to turn it off bc I thought I was saving the day.....I wasn't.

The Bartender was asking around "who tapped off my beer?!" And he seemed upset and we owned up to it. We apologized. He was like "don't do that". That's all he said. He was pissed. 

Idk. I get being territorial. I do. But we are visiting from 6 hours away and have a background in the business and the staff here gives no fux. 

We've gone around town all day and there are much friendlier bartenders elsewhere. I'm sure the rude bartenders have their reasons but play the game. Yaknow??? Hi I'm nice. Be nice. I'm from out of town. Ugh.
author: Ashley H.

description:
We like to come here to get away from the usual haunts in the avenues, the usual crowd at our neighborhood bars.  Change of pace and all.  No pretense, just good solid drinking with a band of soldiers there to do the same.  All ages and backgrounds are here, most well-worn.  Don't come here looking for Mr/Mrs. Right.  Just don't - it's not what this bar is for.

Use the patio to smoke, and not the sidewalk.  If you smoke on the sidewalk, you'll get hit up for a cigarette by every single person walking past, and even a few from the bar who follow you out for that very reason alone.  For some reason they don't follow you to the patio...
author: Meg W.

description:
This place is magical!

Of the coolest bars in SF, pretty much everyone will tell you that it's Zeitgeist. However, Gold Cane is a better, less hipster, friendlier version of Zeitgeist....The bartenders are just good folks, not alternative fashion plates! :o)
author: T. G.

description: The bar tender was an asshole.  I left a dollar tip for the first beer. No tip for the second, then on the third he made some off-handed comment claiming that I don't tip.
author: Eric B.

description: Devoid of tourists. That in and of itself makes this place great. The bartenders are sweet and not arrogant. The beers are cheap and plentiful. Small back patio (closes early for noise reasons though.) Pool table. Great large table in the window with excellent people watching. This is my go-to first date bar ;-)
author: Whitney M.

description:
We stopped by here for a quick drink and to get off our feet after some intense shopping up in the Haight. Honestly, we should have gone to Hobson's a few doors down. The bartender was distracted and busy talking to other customers instead of taking our drink order (and he wasn't serving, he was being way too chatty/friendly, which is *extremely* frustrating when you're waiting for service); the music was super loud, to the point that conversations were nearly impossible with someone right next to you; and ultimately the bathroom was super gross: it smelled like pee and had an open window with people standing underneath. That latter bit wasn't too bad (although a bit uncomfortable) until someone opened a door next to the open window and was pretty much at eye level to my eyes as I was sitting on the can. OH HELL NO.

It wasn't the worst experience I've had, hence the two-star rating instead of one, but I'd make a point of going to Hobson's over this place in the future. Or I'll try out some of the other pubs and divebars in the Haight-Ashbury area over this.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
There's bars and then there's dive bars. It's a fine line and what distinguishes them is blurry and vague and mostly based on opinion more than nething else. I've been to a lot of dives and this one qualifies in my book. Nothing fancy, no gimmicks, no cool lighting. Just cheap, dirty, and no judging eyes, prob my fav part. If u want a beer alone you can easily blend into the corner. 

Came here on a Monday nite. There's ample table space and a good long bar with plenty of stools. There's TV's all over for sports fans and a pool table if u like a drunken game. The music is cranked up and usually some droning rock you won't recognize, prob from the grunge section at the record store that only sells vinyls no one wants. 

The beer cozy's have trivia on them which is cool if you're bored but not that interesting. "What us state borders only one other?" "What are the only 2 landlocked countries in South America?" That kind of thing. 

There's def some history to this place but nothing that memorable, which fits it. No one wants to be remembered here. There's no FB photos to commiserate the nite here. It's a place to get drunk and party and yell or keep hush and forget your problems one way or the other. 

The one defining thing in this place is the back patio. Cool open space where u can drink, smoke, and be loud regardless of all the be respectful of our neighbors signs. 

Is come here again to get drunk or disappear only one of which I can do at my preferred dive of choice down the street. Zim Zam. There's better music and no TV's there, which are prob the only real downsides of this place.
author: Harrison M.

description: Sweet li'l dive. I hated it the first few times I came, once I started to relax, I saw yeah - this is a fun place packed w/ chill folks and cheap drinks. $4 for a cocktail in the middle of Friday night! Dirty electronic games. Good jukebox tunes & cash only but an ATM is in the bar.
author: Em L.

description: Cheap and stiff...Divey with a  back outdoor patio, great juke box and small pool table...A great place to get drunk for cheap...
author: Fernando A.

description:
A normal bar with both sitdown booths and....the bar. Music is a little too loud for me and the 5 selection of beers on tap is not super interesting. I actually don't remember anything other than Anchor Steam. Price is good with tap beers being $4ish and bottled PBR being $2.50. The bartender was friendly and enthusiastic but we had some difficult getting his attention sometimes to get more rounds.

Crowd seemed mostly casual folks, not super blue collar nor super white collar. We had a couple making out next to us for a long time and it was kind of weird (I didn't feel uncomfortable or whatever, just weird that the bartender let it go on).
author: John N.

description:
Why are dive bar drink slingers so oddly sessy?

Maybe it's because they ply us with cheap, stiff drinks or maybe they just look good against a splintered bar top but damn. Another blood mary, please!

With our girls' weekend winding down, we needed some serious vodka therapy after a serious retail session. The pack patio is like sitting behind your hipster friend's duplex, and a great place to unwind.

Most importantly? 2 bloodies and a Guiness were only $15. Mind. Blown.
author: Christa Y.

description:
This is a great local dive bar in the upper haight.

Drinks are cheap ($5 or less), and this place is never packed so it's easy to get a seat/table and just hang out and relax.

I enjoy sitting by the front window and watching the people walking by, it's equally as enjoyable to just people watch the other patrons of the bar, as it welcomes everyone and you get a great taste of the local atmosphere.

I highly recommend checking out this place if you're in the mood for a cheap drinks at a local regulars dive bar.
author: Ayall S.

description:
How does one start a day in the haight?
At the Gold Cane!!!!

It's a nice lil dark divey bar down there in the haight. Service wasnt that bad and I cant say much about the food. However the drinks were spot on and what else could keep me warm that cold day but a group favorite - irish whiskey! 

Be prepared with the cash, no credit card accepted. 
;D
author: John-Michael C.

description: Horrible, know-it-all bar tender. Don't go here, even if the drinks are cheep. You will pay in horrible service.
author: Nicole S.

description: Really awesome dive with amazing locals. Some lady told me how beautiful I am (never happens) and then doused me in perfume, in a fun way. Our bartender was awesome and gave us tons of good SF tips. If he ever reads this, we did indeed go to Lands End and it was awesome. Hope to see you around NY!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Ahh, the Gold Cane.  This has been my go-to place for a quick, chill beer whenever I find myself in the Haight. Don't let the name fool you, this ain't no snoot-n-toot high-brow monacle-wearin' pimp-daddy extravaganza. This here is Divey McCrustydrunk.... it's Fighty McPukenstumble... it's Drinky McDrankydrunk. 

This no frills, no pretense cash-only joint is a quintessential SF dive bar. Decent liquor selection, friendly bartenders, pretty good brews on tap, wooden tables/chairs, solid bar, and supposedly a good patio out back (and windows that open wide to the street int the front). The prices are plenty reasonable for being on the Haight and having such a fancy name. 

The last time I was in, however, was a doozy. Post B2B, the place was jam packed full of WASTED drunk people, half in costume, 3/4 sunburned, and all 3-sheets to the wind. I almost witnessed a fight, and was actually surprised that a couple of dudes didn't end up with a bottle of Smirnoff Ice lodged firmly upside their heads. It was a rowdy scene, to say the least. Most of the rest of the times I have been in the joint, it's been super mellow. I'm guessing that, while weekend nights get rowdy, the post B2B crowd was a little beyond. 

All in all, a good, solid liquor dispensary.
author: Don B.

description:
During my almost week-long stay with a friend who lives a block from this place, I came here about 4 times. Crazy, right? I'm in a city for the first time and spend the majority of my evenings here? Well, there is a reason that my friends call this place their local watering hole and by the end of my trip, I understood why.

It's a total dive, that's for damn sure. The decor isn't anything special, there is a pool table in the back, and a back patio that looks like it belongs in someone's house instead of a bar. Despite that, I felt totally at home. This is the type of place where everyone knows each other and the bartenders know what you want before you even order. Hell, by my last night they knew that I was after a Lagunitas IPA. Pretty awesome, if I do say so myself. 

In terms of beer, it's ok. Nothing super amazing, but considering most of the dives in my neighborhood in Philly only serve the main domestics and pony bottles of Rolling Rock, I was more than content with Lagunitas and Fat Tire on draft. All beer is $4, too! Such a steal. I love it. 

As I previously alluded, the staff is really nice and awesome. I got into a conversation about classical music with one of them because apparently sometimes I sing "thank you" without even realizing it and he picked up my vibrato. Definitely sit and talk to them; they are interesting people. 

If I lived here, you better believe the Cane would be my go-to bar. It just felt like a nice bar-home away from home.
author: Lauren D.

description: We were only here for one quick beer before further adventures, so I can't get too in depth in my review. This place was perfectly low key, though, and the bartender was so friendly! The place isn't fancy or over the top in any way and seems welcoming to everyone, which was nice since we were caught feeling a little out of place during parts of our trip. Remember, it's cash only, though!
author: Kaitlin D.

description: Really sketchy establishment. I do not give bad reviews often but the people here act like they are too "cool" for school.  Tattoos. Piercings. Weirdos.  The bartenders here have no tact and do not know how to treat their patrons. Come here only if you want the worst of dive bars and want to be treated like you have zero class.
author: Jacquelyn K.

description:
Dude, never again. The getting wasted part that is. Bartender ruled, drinks were strong, music was good.....

I will definitely return, but NOT to get wasted I tell you! Especially on a Wednesday afternoon.
author: Rachel G.

description:
Good old Gold Cane.
Plain Jane Gold Cane.
Bargain Basement Gold Cane.

I don't go into places like this during prime drinking hours, aka, between 7 and midnight Thurs-Sat.  It's a great Tuesday afternoon place.  The interior couldn't be more plain, and that's actually good because the basic design eliminates the tourists and those folks (including many MANY Yelpers) who would condemn a place like this as a Dive Bar.  It's another great example of a neighborhood bar.  

Lots of career barflys, great bartenders, the trivia napkins are always fun, and the drinks are CHEAP.  If you want to take your friend from out of town to a place with "personality" take them to Hobson's.  If you want to talk to your friend and goof around and enjoy the great jukebox, take them to the Cane.

Bonus points for a backyard area that again isn't fancy, but it's outside.  Bathroom report:  two of them, his and hers, very plain, and almost completely without graffitti.  The last two times I was there, both his and hers were in good shape.
author: Nelson W.

description:
I dropped by Gold Cane last night for what I thought would be some insane drink deals.  Upon entering the premises I felt an intense feeling of deja vu.  I felt like I had walked this walk before, the look and feel of Gold Cane was all too familiar.

And then it hit me, I was at this bar before... Many moons ago, when I was a younger man on a bachelor party bar crawl.  Unfortunately I could not relive the revelry of that night, the Cane was packed and impossible to get a drink.  I will have to try again next time I'm in the area.  3 dollar wells sound awesome.
author: Eric L.

description:
Dropped by for my 21st birthday, since I wanted the dive bar experience, and it was great. 

I like my whiskey, so I asked the bartender to make me something with that. He ended up fixing me a Manhattan, up. It was delicious, and would've only cost me $5, but he gave it to me free for my birthday. A nice tip for you, sir! I ordered a Salty Dog after, and it was still solid and cheap. Most of my friends ordered beer, which was super cheap, about $4 a pint. The atmosphere and people were pretty chill, not too mellow but also not too crazy. The music was great, and the jukebox had a superb selection: from classics (Etta James, Nina Simone) to eclectic (Talking Heads) to a few modern things (Black Keys, Built to Spill). Three songs for a buck... Yes!

Only minor downside was that my friend didn't dig her Long Island Iced Tea ($8). It was tasty to me though! 

The friends and I will definitely come back. Honestly, it'll be a regular stop for me from now on. Cheap and solid mixed drinks and beer. Cash only, bud!
author: Trang N.

description:
Great prices, and I absolutely love drinking a beer in the afternoon at their outdoor patio area. The fact that they have a bathroom in the patio area gives it 4 stars alone.

There may be some Grateful Dead riff-raff overstaying their welcome at your table (it is Haight St, afterall), but they mean well. Now if only the place itself didn't constantly reek of old booze and flat beer.

Ah, all good things in life are achieved with compromises.
author: Katie S.

description: Super chill bar with good people and a great bartender (Jason). Came to watch the 49er game on Sunday and it wasn't packed at all. Keep in mind it is CA$H ONLY. Bigger than  your typical dive bar with a great homeyness to it.
author: Adlyn S.

description: A Monday early afternoon start with the help of the Irish lass that bartends here will make your drinking experience a enjoyable one. Great Juke and drinks with a patio outback,what more do you want.
author: Dave S.

description:
Solid dive bar - played some pool, hung out on the back patio, drank several beers. 

Definite piss smell, but don't let that deter you from having a good time - I would definitely go back.
author: David G.

description: Attentive bartenders.  Great cocktails and a good crowd.  They have plenty of seating and an outdoor patio. Every time I have been I have seen a familiar face or two, a pretty good sign in my opinion.  This is a great place to grab a cocktail or two before or after dinner or just because you feel like a cocktail.  It is super casual and always has  good music playing.
author: Tristen C.

description: I recently moved into the Haight Asbury area and stumbled in here on a Friday night. Totally unpretentious vibe, the service was super friendly and the Bloody Mary was certainly not lacking its Tabasco. Pretty much the perfect dive bar.
author: Benjamin C.

description:
This is my new local spot - Hands down. Huge patio, huge inside seating area, pool table and friendly staff. 

psst - make sure you put your name on the pool list if you dare to play. Locals get pretty, pretty fierce if you try and sneak in a game. (I may or may not of gotten into a fight over this.)
author: Jessica A.

description: Yep - it's a dive bar but MY dive bar.  Always full of characters, back patio, pool table and stiff drinks.  Cool bartenders.
author: Phil G.

description:
I love the cane.

It's a great local dive with some trippy characters consistently posted up at the bar.  
Sometimes my whiskey coke is $2.50, sometimes it's $4, whatever! 

there is an outside patio too, granted hgtv could have a field day back their remodeling it, it's still a good spot to enjoy some skunky smelling fresh air ;)
author: Fresh M.

description: Best dive on Haight.   Local booze, local people, local dogs and local treekids from the park. Decent pool table.  Whats not to like.
author: Johnny C.

description:
Ah the Gold Cane.  You have a ridiculously awesome jukebox.  You have hard core regulars and people who like the Giants even with Bonds and their crappy season. You're one of the true dives in the upper Haight besides Murio's Trophy room.  Recently, and I'm actually embarrassed to admit this but I found out you have a patio that you can smoke on.  I've been going to the Gold Cane since college and I graduated from there 5 1/2 years ago.  My cousin came home super drunk.  
"How was the Gold Cane?"  
"Oh it was awesome we hung out on the patio!"  
"Umm what patio, you must have gone to a different bar." 
 "No there was a patio I swear..."  
I've never made it past the first 6 bar stools.  Even though you are cash only I will keep frequenting your bar.
author: Kristin Marie S.

description:
definitely a legit place, me and friend came in here to get away from the rain.

the staff is really nice, and drinks are cheap.

you can also play a game of pool for $1!

definitely a good place to relax and chat it up with a friend
author: Jaime D.

description:
Update 1/17/08

Pumping this place up to 5 stars! Went here the other night and the bartender (Mark, I believe) was just the coolest around. Talking with folks, professional, and just making sitting at the bar a fun experience. It's folks like him that make me want to come back repeatedly whenever I'm in the Haight!

******
One of my favorite drinking spots in the city. a no-nonsense bar with friendly barkeeps and laid back folk. i've had some of the most interesting conversations at this bar and it's a good mix of patrons that drink here.
author: Art O.

description:
My friends and I first started at Deluxe Club or Club Deluxe, whatever, and decided it was a bit too crowded for us.  We found a table in the corner by the bathroom and kitchen so there was constant movement by us.  People were touching my friend in places I'm sure he hasn't been touched in a while.  We decided to move.

Gold Cane was nice and roomy.  The music was turned up a bit too loud but the tunes were great and we had zero desire to move from that place after we settled in.  The drinks were cheap and the workers constantly around to grab cups away from our table.  I think my friends and I are feeling a little old (group age range: 24-30 ha!) and seriously don't want to be bothered by the big crowds when we go out and talk.
author: Ashley I.

description:
The tables by the window smell of urine and beer, but the books, pool tables and outside patio make up for it. They have PBR in bottle for all the hipster Hitlers out there...

Been here a few times, if you sit by the window be ready to enjoy a free show as many of the colorful characters of San Francisco Haight area will walk by, and frequently attempt to talk to you, them selves, or the pink bunny standing next to you...
author: Robert P.

description: Cheapest drinks in the Haight and probably the city.  Bartenders are very friendly and fun to talk to.  There's one pool table that stays busy.  The back patio is great, especially on nice days or if you're a smoker.  The owner Brendan, is probably one of the nicest guys you'll meet.  As mentioned in other reviews, the jukebox is very good and diverse.  During football season Brendan had free footllong hotdogs on MNF during the season.  All in all if you like dive bars that are spacious and easy to get a drink at, then you gotta make your way to the Cane.
author: Thomas Crown O.

description:
I was thrown out of this shit hole by the manager, Brendan, solely because I had a SERVICE DOG with me!

I told him it was illegal to do so.

He just said, "Ehhh whatever..I don't care"

I was tossed out, because of my legally-sanctioned service dog, yet this place is a haven for drug deals, major pot smoking out back in the patio, fights, homeless guys who use the men's room as a shooting gallery, and skanky broads who slither around like Coyote Ugly rejects...wow...

in this economy, does a business owner really want to lose the business of someone who's respectful and a good tipper??

If you go to this bar and give this hot-tempered, sexually-frustrated, unmarried 50+ Irish fugitive your money, please do so knowing he is prejudice, creepy, and hates service dogs. Yeah, the dogs that help disabled people.
author: Scott T.

description: GOLD CAAAAAAAAANE! Please never close. Your back patio makes me feel like I'm a person again. Or maybe that's the giant tequila shot...
author: Amelie P.

description:
We almost saw a throw down in here last night after B2B.

Homeboy had WAAAAaaaaaay to much to drink and was cursing out his friends, yelling (so angry spit was flying as he was cursing out his friends) before he headed back out the door here to his Zima malt beverage he had waiting outside on the street for him.

He continued to yell through the window out on the street, and was so mad that I was surprised that the bottle didn't end up back in the bar, in someone's head or on the floor next to them.

At any rate, the Lagunitas was delicious and thankfully it came in a red keg cup. Good call, Gold Cane. I think my evening would have been very different if those beers of yours would have come in pint glasses.

I'd come back if I find myself in the Haight when I'm in town again. It looks like they have a decent patio out back.
author: Katie A.

description: This place is great for a quick drink or 2 if I am in the neighborhood.  I do not usually stay much longer as there are always other places on my evenings agenda. The bartender is great, decent pool table, and a nice outdoor area.  The prices are very reasonable, in fact you won't find beer much cheaper anyplace else unless it is happy hour.
author: JT N.

description: I went here on a Whim because I thought it would be better than the other places where I was earlier. Nope just a regular bar looks like a sports bar, the people I talked to were from out of town. Not really impressed with this spot, I'm very picky when it comes to bars, the drinks are cheap though on the plus side.
author: Nicholas A.

description:
ALL KILLER NO FILLER.
stiff, extremely cheap drinks.
great tunage.
lots of table space (excellent table at front to play beer hockey on)
cash only (whatevs, it keeps the drink prices down)
rough and tumble crowd 
patio for smokey mcgees
i've come here twice now, and each time gotten wasted off my ass. sometimes they only have one bartender working, and ordering drinks can be a process, but OVERALL, this is my new favorite bar.
author: Maureen P.

description:
Oh, the Cane!  

I have been living in this neighborhood for years, and always find a friendly face, strong drink and a good laugh at this bar.

I love the bartender who works on Fridays and Saturdays (Jason?) because he's genuine, funny and makes a great drink.

I also love Archana who works there once in a while, And Carrie who is totally rad as well...coolest female bartenders ever.  

Outdoor smoking area, relaxed atmosphere, a great lineup on the jukebox and all the best sports on the flat screens really add up.

AND, did I mention that the drinks are a steal?  Forget the other neighborhood bars, you will get a great drink, for a great deal, made with love by a great person.  

You can't go wrong with the Gold Cane.  

If I could kiss it, I would.
author: One Girl's Opinio N.

description:
This was my go to place on weekends. If you want rowdy college kids, or to hook-up, go across the street to O'Brians.

Gold Cane is the place to chill, drink a Guiness, escape the hassle of Haight St., and basically just hang out with friends. It has probably the world's best jukebox, ever. And the bartenders and other patrons are usually really cool, laid back people.

Just remember to bring cash.
author: pollywog e.

description: Pretty cool dive in the Haight-Ashbury area. My buddy took me here, he said this is where the locals within the area like to congregate. Me and my buddy had a brew on the back patio. Some people were smoking their medicine, which was expected and pretty cool i think since we were in the Haight-Ashbury area after all. Overall, Cool dive to check out if you're around the area.
author: Rohan P.

description:
Solid drinks (great selection of beers on tap), great jukebox, friendly patrons (mostly locals). The makings of a great dive! 

I've been to bars in this neighborhood before... but this has a true feel of what a dive in the Haight should be. 

*Make sure to check out the back patio... bonus ; )
author: Brenda G.

description:
Great place for a pint in the Haight.   $4 for a pint of Laganitas and the place is comfortable and laid back.   One could say it'a bit of a dive bar, but in a good way!
The bartender was friendly and we felt quite welcome there. Plus the jukebox is great. Would defintiely go back!
author: Karen M.

description: This is TOTALLY my kind of place. There was a free table for four of us on a Friday night, room at the bar for me to go up and get drinks, and a great casual atmosphere. I don't remember individual drink prices but I think it was pretty cheap.
author: Erin A.

description: This is my neighborhood bar. Brandon the bar tender is a sweetheart. The bar inside is ok but the backyard is where the party is. It's a fabulous  two level garden with a giant green house which they occasionally open for high traffic times like bay to breakers and the height st fair. The crowd consists of all ages 21 and over. I always have a great time just chatting with whoever is there. Very chill spot.
author: Justine P.

description: Fun and quirky atmosphere that only a genuine dive bar can provide. Great hang out with decently priced drinks and fun trivia questions on the napkins!
author: Bridget B.

description:
They have a really fun bar game back there. If you see MNR on the highest scores on any of the games on the machine, that was me, and my former bar companion.

I think the bartender was drunk (which I appreciate).
author: Rachel F.

description:
Leave it to Yelp to notice when you are taking a little hiatus from the addiction of wasting countless hours on the internet writing embarrassing anecdotes about your bad behavior while throwing in (hopefully) one minuscule tidbit of useful information about a place to the general public who are far too smart to use the site for anything other than its intended purpose. Leave it to Yelp to lure you back in like a crack dealer giving a kid their first rock for free. 

Thanks, Yelp for pointing out my tendency toward extremes by publishing my ROTD of my extreme (and extremely difficult) behavior of going vegan for a month. Thanks also for doing it right at the time I thought I was kicking my Yelp habit, thus sucking me in once again to the extreme behavior of wanting more bar reviews than anyone else on Yelp. 

This now leads me to write about my extreme behavior of not drinking for a month, and what happens when that month is over. 

You end up at the Gold Cane. A bar that, though it is spacious and has a back patio for nice days and nicotine addicts, as well as a decent selection of alcohol and a casual yet not quite dirty feel, you just can't bring yourself to go to unless you are completely trashed. 

I don't know what it is about this place but it just lacks personality. In its decor, in its patrons, even in its patio which is such a rare commodity in any SF establishment it can't help but be appreciated. 

Not at the Gold Cane. It is forgotten by me, until my friends drag me here for my 5th cocktail on 5 hours after not drinking for 32 days...which lands me on the floor, where I lose my keys and dignity and where I finally realize that even the floors are nondescript. It is also where I realize I would much rather be extreme than nondescript.
author: Drue C.

description:
Patio that you can smoke on....1 star
Ample space for a somewhat large group of people....1 star
Pool table that you can hustle on...1 star
Relatively cheap drinks that you can consume and will lead you to believe you can hustle pool....1 star

Yah...thats all i got.  Its a bar on Haight.  Good for hopping...but i wouldn't necessarily spend an entire evening here.
author: Lauren F.

description:
This place has a 12 foot deep end, so feel free to dive in.  One of the diviest bars in the entire city, but I still love it. Mostly because of the cheap beers and the outside smoking section. 

I recommend hitting this place up if you are in the mood for a smoking patio and are in the Haight. They also have liars dice.
author: E-dough R.

description:
This was an escape from the craziness of the Haight st fair. 
Michelle, KP and I were in need of a beer. We had run into Jessica T who recommended we check out the patio. They had the whole thing open. We made our way through the crowd and found ourselves on the patio. Yeah, they even had a bar up there. 
We were actually able to hang out there for awhile.
It is all about the patio.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
A short list of why the Gold Cane is one of best places on Haight to get good and roaring drunk:

1) Three dollar well drinks.

2) A clientele that is always diverse. Wanna-be bike messenger looking dudes rub shoulders with grizzled SF barflys, and look! There's a hippie chick squinting hard at the jukebox and staggering.

3) Free books in the back! Yes, most of them are weird advance printing of books you'd never want, but I've picked up Salman Rushdie, Richard Yates, and Myra Goldberg for free here.

4) Speaking of picking up, this is not a pick-up bar. Not that it doesn't happen, it's just the raison d'etre of this place is one thing: pulling that liquid blanket nice and tight around yourself.

5) The back patio, which lets those of you who still like to get high a place to do it and also letting a cigarette smoker like myself a place to enjoy my drink and my company while destroying my lungs.

6) They have a barback who is really nice and completely out of his mind. He told me one night that Jim Jones put a demon inside of him when he was a boy, and that there are "at least fourteen demons living in San Francisco." Where, I asked, are they living? "Mostly in the Mission."
author: Jake S.

description:
If I were a professional but not very creative sitcom pitcher and I wanted to model a show after Cheers but set it here in SF, I would probably use the GC as my inspiration.  Aside from maybe Gino and Carlo's, I think the Cane most consistently offers the best and most authentic frisco (oops, sorry) flava.

In addition to the amay back patio, ample seating, and affable staff (they seem to give out free jukebox picks like they grow on trees), the GC boasts a couple of well situated TVs, so I typically stumble over to catch whatever game I happen to be missing due to my lack of cable.  I prefer it to Kezar Pub because it is less crowded, and I don't end up missing critical 4th quarter/9th inning/3rd period (? not so much a hockey fan) minutes waiting at the bar.

Three cheers and five stars for the Cane!
author: Erica B.

description: Saloon type bar with a great jukebox and a pool table.  There is an open area in the back to chill and/or smoke.  Drink prices are standard.  It gets pretty busy, even on weekdays, and has large round tables for your parties of 6 or 7. Good spot.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Do you like the taste of alcohol?

Hells yeah, I sure do. What a night? Drinking with some friends of mine here last night for his going away party was something else. It started with me driving here around 9pm, looking for the place was rather hard, but I managed. The first thing I saw upon entering was the drink specials, any well mix drinks for $3. 

Now, you know me, I love me a good drink especially when it's that cheap. Later on that evening, we were asking shooting the breeze outside the back patio having fun when the neighbors called and said, we were being loud. Thanks neighbors! 

So, we decided to move it along the streets. Somehow during the night, things started getting worst when we saw this guy come running towards us, it was no surprise that this guy needed our help. He was in frantic and scared for his life. Our immediate reaction was to help this guy. Following him was this entourage of bullies who obviously wanted to kick his ass, for what reason we don't know. The battlefields were 9 to 5, the 9 being us. We had the advantage, the frantic guy ran into the bar and beg for help. We tried to calm these guys down, obviously we wanted to be heros, instead we let them beat the crap out of the other guy. 

One of the our friends knew one of the other guys, the frantic guy had apparently hit one of the other guy in the face for what reason I don't care to know. It's a crazy world we live in and I don't need to know why people are the way they are. 

Other than that, this bar has a great atmosphere. The bartender is quite nice and old, but he is nice!
author: Stanley K.

description:
Two stars for what appears to be a pimp manning the door! I love a pimp as much as I love a strong cocktail in the morning and Gold Cane delivered. That's where my love affair with this hole ends. 

Leave it to my brother's friends to pick this place. Said friends and I have a long history of tension and mutual dislike for one another because I rock and they do not. That said, this is totally what I would expect them to come up with. 

We showed up around closing time to irritate and be irritated by aforementioned friends and were lucky that Mr. Pimpsuit unlocked the door and let us go in to see my bro. I was unimpressed. Some words that come to mind: old, tired, worn out, musty, smelly...with a crowd to match.

It sounds like the drinks are cheap, so maybe if that's all you care about, this place is ok. With it's proximity to Amir's, I have a feeling we'll find ourselves here again someday.
author: Autumn K.

description:
Lived down the street for 5 years and think the GC saved me a couple thousand dollars in having to go to Hobson's Choice every night.  you could probably actually buy a round for the whole bar at this place and it might still cost less than a night out at red sky for one.

No rules other than we don't give a fuck, be nice to the bartender, and make nice with the crazy people.  

I miss the GC.
author: Lindsay M.

description:
A bar is a bar is a bar.

Guinness on tap.
Not overly gross bathroom.
Happy Hour deal.
In Haight but DOES NOT smell like piss.
author: Jessica L.

description: My buddy introduced me to the Gold Cane and it's quickly become a favorite of mine. It's really easy to meet people there. Great drink prices, pool table, what more can you ask for. It's a no bullshit place. Just a head's up though... cash only. They do have an ATM in the back.
author: Pete F.

description:
I have to give this place five stars. My friend Michael introduced me to it -- when I lived just a few blocks away -- as the only place on Haight where you can hang outdoors. But it's also one of few places where I can say something truly interesting happens, every time I go there. Things like...

1. Some old hippie dude in the back garden starts blubbering when I borrow his guitar for my rendition of "You Can't Always Get What You Want" (it was good, but it wasn't THAT good).

2. A drunk Irishman dances toward me, pulls up his shirt, and takes his front teeth out with his tongue.

3. A male nurse gives me and my friend a huge nug of marijuana before slamming his beer and leaving to start his shift (note to self: never patronize St. Mary's Hospital on Stanyan).

4. I hear Alice and Chains, Bjork, and Coldplay flow out of the jukebox in a row. Huh?!

I just really like this place. Despite the fact that the interior of the bar doesn't have a whole lot of character, and it's always too bright in there... So what. There's LIFE HERE, MAN. Stick around for a while, and you'll encounter some interesting shit.
author: Lisa T.

description: Good place, reasonable drinks, love the back patio area, might be a gay bar. Short summary notwithstanding, I would definitely go back again and give it another try. It has a local feel that I like. No credit cards, cash only. Dive bar, careful if you're hetro!
author: B H.

description:
This is a great little neighborhood dive bar where the drinks are cheap, the bartenders are friendly and the juke box is jammed with some lovely hard to finds.  The back patio is cute but probably more loved by the smokers and not so much by the asthmatics.

Its a great place to pull up a stool and watch the game.  It also appears to be a good place for your drunk friends to easily scoop up and take home a nice piece of classy bar trash.   awesome.
author: Sarah K.

description:
I agree with previous reviewer....  I walked in to watch World Cup Brazil match last Sunday.  The bar was like a library -  quiet & boring - I half expected to be shoooshed.  The matches were on the TVs, but dull, gloomy music was playing.  And they refused to turn up the sound on the games - even as folks were begging and pleading to turn it up.  I can't imagine going out of the way to lose business.... so weird.  Not only would they have picked up business, they would've created a desparately needed ATMOSPHERE.  

File this under "I don't get it".
author: J M.

description:
Saturday afternoon.

At Gold Cane I mulled about the previous night. Where Anne and I were somehow again at the same bourgeois kind-of party-- a trace of red nail polish, ran up the walls from one of the older women with long nails and diamonds. The whole scene fell in much the same way: blazes of witty conversation, scattered blatting about politics. Sometimes even the men raised their glasses to cheer on a dying conversation. 
I knew that these people were carried away with money and power, and the proof-- they were always trying to prove they had been right by namecalling and hostility. They looked so awfully beautiful, pausing to sip their scotch or martinis.   
There was a girl more humble than the others who talked to us. She owned several yoga studios. She'd lived in Montana all her life until she wanted to go places and moved to San Francisco. 

Which brings me to my point.
Anne, me, and our new friend sat at Gold Cane, laughing-- raising our hands to brush our hair away from our cheeks. The hairdos we styled last night now coming down upon the shoulders. 
We thought we were better than them, as if we could be proud of being working class. We were glad in all sorts of ways.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Cheapest drinks in the Haight. Don't be surprised if your Top Shelf firewater here has a suspicious Bomb Shelter whiff about it.

A destination? Not so much. More of an, "We're stuck here so we may as well get trashed-ination".

Smokeasy on the patio. For kicks, sit next to the regular rummy who can kill with breath alone.
author: Jeremy W.

description: Super dive-y and super cheap. Kind of a dumpy patio out back but it does the trick. The crowd there is what you'd expect, maybe a little older. Musk, old place but super friendly bar tenders and perfect for a neighborhood bar. Like most places in the Haight, Cash only.
author: christine c.

description: True dive, real chill, nice people, crowd and bartender. Fair pricing on drink, without stiffing you. I'll need to come back and play some pool. There is a back area if you need some air. Good seating arrangement, a lot of seating.
author: Brian S.

description: Popped in here last night after the Friday Nights at the De Young event...was an easy natural progression to go from the museum to here in the Haight.  Had some Citron sodas and shot some pool.  Still one of my favorites places to hit in this part of the Haight.  Fun times and Escape from NY pizza is in the next block.  Good drinks, fairly priced, and there's a good pool table too.  Nice long bar with a friendly crowd of all ages and backgrounds.  Because of the length of the bar, it can still get crowded, but it's never too crowded and so even on weekends, it's never a zoo.  Fun place and there are some people who really love pool that hang out here...works for me!
author: Roy N.

description: Love this little dive bar in the heart of the Haight. they always help me with my pool game, and the back patio is sweet.
author: Lisa S.

description:
I almost broke my hip on the back steps!
But other than that this bar is awesome.
Cheap stiff drinks, a good easy atmosphere, and a large backyard.
Some of the bumpiest pool tables in the city, master these and you'll be hustling hand over fist.
author: Theo R.

description:
Gold Cane!

Good prices, friendly bartenders, and an outside patio area. It is in general a very friendly bar, an excellent place to meet people or see people you know already.

The only downside, is some nights it attracts a weird crowd. 

One night I went there and it was full of freshly divorced dudes in their 40s. Seriously, like twenty of them. There must have been a convention or something. Being young and somewhat cute, me and my friends going into Gold Cane on that night was like a bloody steak sashaying into the midst of a pack of starving dire wolves. We ended up switching to Trax right quick.

But, I have also had really good times here too, and many more good times to come, I'm sure.
author: Rachel H.

description:
If you're into dives you'll dig it the most. Cheap, strong drinks. Smelly atmosphere. Cheeky bartender of ambiguous sexual preference. Jukebox with Wu-Tang. Cigarette smoke wafting in from both the back patio and the streetfront windows. Moose head on the wall. Pool table.

I've seen people piss their pants and/or vomit in the main bar area.

In other words, a little slice of heaven in the H/A.
author: Trav W.

description:
Whoever decided to call this place Gold Cane, deserves a Gold freaking star. This gem reminds me why I love the Haight and need to come 'round more often.

First off, you walk in and the smell is unmistakable. I don't mean in a bad way, simply the moldy, musky, scent of a Midwest dive bar. Beer soaked carpets, pool tables, dart boards...

Where else can you find such an eclectic crowd?  My favorite was a guy, clearly stoned out of his mind, doing some version of tai chi while he sat at his table drinking a Stella. Or, equally as entertaining, the drunk bartender reprimanding our group for moving the tables around (as he muttered in what sounded like Klingon under his breath).  

There's never a dull moment. The bar is great, they have great beers and there's even an outdoor area for the smokers in your group. The Gold Cane is my idea of a perfect night out. A great place to chill with friends, catch up and relax. And see some fun characters. :)
author: Stephanie W.

description:
AWESOME dive bar in the Haight!  Friendly, attentive bar staff, cheap drinks, great selection, witty banter circulating from all groups and a noticeable entourage of regulars that give every neighborhood bar its character.  I've always gotten a good vibe from this place.  I'm a fan of Hobson's too, but the Cane never lets me down (esp. when Hobson's is packed).  

And no, you don't need the Haight Street fair raging outside just to have a good time here.
author: Kerry D.

description:
For nostalgia's sake, I had to write a review about this place.

In college, my friends and I would come here...oh, constantly.  It is so laid back and great, you can smoke in the back, and the drinks are priced accordingly within a college student's budget...I was outraged to go back and find out they raised their well drinks recently by $0.25...which made them $3.00...haha...

The bartenders are really nice, if they aren't wasted, and make a mean drink...almost to the extent of..."um, excuse me, Bartender...can I have some more mixer in this?  It's flammable as is..."

which, if you're going to get drunk for cheap, this is your place.  It's a dive bar for sure, but it holds a special place in my heart :)
author: Kristin E.

description:
This is indeed the long-sought-after neighborhood bar.  I wanted it to be Hobson's so bad, but I just can't stand it on a weekend evening.  The Gold Cane is cheap, casual, friendly, and I like the jukebox.

Love the history, the regulars, and the bar staff.
author: Bobby C.

description:
I like a bar where the bartender drinks. I love a bar where the bartender is drunk. I love the Gold Cane. Went here with some friends who wanted to drink and smoke. The Gold Cane had them covered. The drinks were strong and cheap. Tipsy bartender would give a little extra pour to top off your glass before serving you your drink. When my little extra bit completely missed the glass, I knew my bartender had had more than me.

There's a pool table, a jukebox, and a large, split-level smoking patio. The drinks are cheap ($4 for a generous pour of Powers Irish Whiskey). There were a couple TVs playing college football, but no one in the half-filled bar seemed to mind.
author: Timothy O.

description:
Reeks of piss and soapy urinal cakes, but what $3.50/pint of beer dive doesn't?

(Review purposely kept short, because, well, if you want to smell like you just got a swirlie, that's your own damn fault.)
author: Devon S.

description:
Free Books!

Any bar that advances literacy while pouring some great beer is a five star establishment in my book.  After a weekend of laying low and exercising (I know, how FUN!) I decided to head out into the late afternoon Sunday sun and grab some beers with a friend.  

The last lazy rays of sun (I LOVE OCTOBER HOLY CRAP) were our company, along with a mix mosh of young, old, homeless and hip sitting on the back patio here. No pretence at this bar, just plastic chairs, an old table and trash cans filled with recyclables as your outdoor decor.  I especialy liked that the napkins come with trivia questions, always a fun past time for the beer drinkers of the world. 

Good times!  Oh yes, and there are lots of free books.  I'm reading my selection "Rides in the Chariot" to and from work on the muni, death and tragedy in the Australian outback, fabu!
author: Claire C.

description:
Jameson = $4.00 = 5 star review!!!

I love making friends with other drunk girls waiting for the bathroom in the stink corridor.
author: Jen I.

description: A very nice bartender who happens to have a strong interest in art, especially Neo Rauch. Your typical dive bar. If you want beer (Anchor Steam, Fat Tire, Blue Moon) at a reasonable price in an environment where nobody bugs you, this is your place to be. Love places like this. No chi chi, just straight drinks. THUMBS UP!
author: Dave T.

description:
Nothing fancy here. Got my drink on with my bf the other night. 
Sheeesh- we had a good time! 
Good drinks, strong and cheap. 
Great jukebox tunes. 
Pool table. 
Window seating. 
Comfortable, fun, and all I need in a local dive bar.
author: Amy J.

description:
I was pretty drunk by the time I got in here.  

So I'll write what I remember, I dont get what people are complaining about on the grime, I didn't notice it.

The Jukebox had some good tunes and it wasnt ripping me off either, so that was good.  The price of the drinks are solid for what you get.

Maybe next time, I'll come a little sober so I can find my way to this back patio people are talking about lol.
author: Mark L.

description: If you're older than 30 avoid Friday & Saturday nights. Otherwise great basic bar with genuine local flavor. Pool table, clean bathrooms, and fair prices. We love it even though there are a few regulars that are looking for trouble. Learning who the are and avoiding them is very helpful.
author: B K.

description:
2 drinks = $7.00. Yay!
Tunes = Rockin
Space = plenty of tables for you and your drinkin pals
Staff = Super, duper nice

This is the place where my partner and I decided that there is some sort of conspiracy in the bar business. 

Straight bar (said bar): 2 craft beers = $7.00
Gay bar (names withheld): 2 of the same craft beers = $10.00

Hmmmmm...

But I digress....

Gold Cane is good in my book, for sure.
author: Kristin H.

description:
Good people.
Strong drinks.
Outdoor patio and drunken debauchery. 

It's a homey little Haight Street dive.

It's not as dirty as Murio's, not as Marina as Hobson's and not as expensive as Aub Zam Zam.

Me Likey.
author: Jessica P.

description:
What can I say?  I love a dive bar where I can sit outside, drink my beers, indulge in whatever I want, and play pool if I feel so inclined.

A personal favorite.  -1 star for being cash only, but I suppose it's better than using cards and raising the prices.
author: Max A.

description:
I like the Gold Cane, and it may be one of two things I miss having moved from the Haight, the other being my proximity to spa 410.  

I like the fact that when you are so drunk you drop your gin and tonic and break a glass, the bartender consoles you with a fresh drink.  

I like the fact that when I meet someone and they say they are a regular at the cane, I know they are good people. 

I also like the fact that when my out of town guest heard me talk about this bar, she thought I said "lick old penis"  Why the hell would I go to a bar named "lick old penis"?  seriously, what is that?
author: Emilia D.

description: Yup..total dive bar! But I like it! Simple, casual and relaxing! This is a cool spot to just drink a few beers with some friends and watch the Angel game!
author: Ninja N.

description:
Whenever I'm in the Haight I always try to make a point to stop by the Gold Cane. I've done this many times and the only rough experience was during last week's Haight Street Fair when every creep and jerk from the Marina and North Beach came to this part of town, put on a pair of Chuck Taylor's they bought at a boutique somewhere and decided to play hippy. Not much fun when having to wait over 25 minutes for a drink. Not the bar's fault at all by the way. 

Ok. So this is a great spot. The staff is really friendly and they have some of the best drink deals in town. You can take anyone here because it's divey enough for people like me but won't scare away those who frequent dank holes less often. I come here with "The Knitta'" quite often and we always have a blast. For awhile there was this one woman who used to sit at the end of the bar and get wildly drunk. She looked like she used to be in a girl group from the 60's with her pompadore hair and all. She once stood in the middle of the bar and lifted up her skirt to show everyoone her Va-J-J in a drunken stupor. "Dirty Ryan" and I winced but we went right back to drinking and lived to tell another tale from the great spot. Killer jukebox too!
author: Benji T.

description: Cheap drinks and has a pool table! $1 a game! I wish I could remember more, but I remember enough that we stayed here for a couple drinks before moving to the next bar!
author: Jerald B.

description:
I like this place even if the last time I was here it smelled like pee all over by the corner. Oh well. It's on Haight!

This is a sports bar though you can't really tell from the outside. The times I have been here the crowd is so nice though. Not your typical sports crowd. Mostly they are young and the beer is SO cheap. $6 for 2 beers. Wow. I wanna go back.

They also have a back patio. I would have never guessed this from looking in through the windows. People bring their guitars and sing. It can get kind of windy so bring a coat or buy more beer.
author: Alexia R.

description:
I used to crash at my friend's place above the corner of Haight and Ashbury. That's how I got to know the Gold Cane.

I continue to go to the Gold Cane because it's a classic dive bar with good cheap drinks, and bartenders that are fast, and can remember what you're drinking for more than ten seconds. 

Between this place, Martin Mack's and The Alembic, I've found my Haight trifecta.
author: kainoa r.

description:
Okay, the Gold Cane...plus three stars for Brendan the bartender.  He's everything a bartender should be...including greeting my husband and I every time for the last three years with "Hey kids!"  He can get away with it because he's (not) old but gray.  And so friendly!  

One star missing for each of the next  two reasons--

1)  The Sunday bartender cards regulars which is nice when you're 21 but gets annoying when you're (read:I'm) 29 and stopping by on my way home from the park with my dog--You know me!  And I'm 29!  Stop carding me, for f'***'s sake!

2)  You have a huge outdoor area and NO RESTAURANT but still DON"T ALLOW DOGS.  It's just a shame that one of the few places in the upper Haight that has an outdoor area is anti-dog.  Bad, bad, bad.
author: kelly m.

description:
Once there was a girl who liked seedy bars with cheap beer, a pool table, a great back patio, and some regular "characters" from the neighborhood.  She came to the Gold Cane and decided it was perfect.  Except for the stale smell, but that goes away after your first beer.

Come to this place expecting that random people will talk to you because they will.  While you order drinks, when you're on the patio, while you are walking from the bar to the patio.  People are friendly.  I like that.
author: Nicci S.

description:
I come here all the time and still haven't written a review. Why is that? Maybe its because I just don't know what to say.

I like it here. I definately like it. I don't know why, but I do.

Maybe its the outdoor smoking patio? Maybe its the $3.50 bloody marys? Maybe its the fact that these $3.50 bloodies are actually tasty? The fact that its never so crowded you can't sit down?

I don't know. But it's good.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
I went to this bar originally with a friend of a friend that became a friend...

I like it because there is cheap beer, good pool and openly friendly conversational people.  The mood here is always relaxed, and you can chat with anyone, especially sitting out back on the patio. I've been here three times now, and like it more every time I go back.

I wouldn't say this is a dive bar.  This is just a bar - nothing fancy, nothing amazing, but a decent enough, relaxed place to get some drinks, play some pool and have some conversation.
author: Jana T.

description: I like dive bars.  They had Newcastle and Guinness...I like to mix both for a Dark Castle (from Yard House).  Good, casual place to kick-it with friends and enjoy drinks!
author: Al C.

description:
It seems like every time I come here I leave feeling happy. I go up to the bar and wait for a perfectly poured Guinness. They know how to pour it right: there's always a four leaf clover in the middle! It's adorable.

Although I've perused over the trivia napkins a thousand times, my boyfriend and I still quiz each other on "What is Amazia?" or "What was the last film George Lucas directed?" It never gets old. 

The jukebox is playing some awesome combination of tunes ranging from Bob Dylan to Morrissey. It's great.

If you venture out to the back patio, you're bound to make a new friend. Sunday afternoons are my favorite times to go. The regulars there are so nice and are always generously sharing some crazy story with you as they pass around the occasional bowl.  I've had some of the most intriguing and bizarre conversations in the back. 

So what if the place smells like piss and staleness? You'll always have a good time. Isn't that what's most important? It's probably the four leaf clover poured into my Guinness gives me good luck for my every visit here.
author: Meghan L.

description:
A sweet dive bar on Haight.  Great G&Ts, real cheap, a good jukebox, pool (though you may have to wait to play, but it's all good), a back patio, and the tables and chairs remind me of a friend's place from back home (not too fancy, as you may have guessed).

This is a good place to just hang out with some friends and throw a few back.  Real low key.
author: Chris M.

description: The best local neighborhood bar in Upper Haight! Jason who works weekend days makes a delicious Bloody Mary and an even better Michelada. It's always a pleasure to see Sharon pouring and she's always a great listener. And Josh in the evenings with his adorable World Series beard makes it pleasurable to have a great $3.50 strong well drink, which is a special every day! I encourage you to stop in and say hi to who ever is working. Everyone there including the regulars are great people. 4 tv's, a pool table, an amazing juke box, and great drinks. Can't beat that!
author: monika l.

description:
I lived a stone throw away from the Gold Cane for about 7 years. I also had the pleasure of having my first legal drink here.

It's a great bar, not really a dive, but a bit rough around the edges, which only adds to the comfortable feel to it.  They have a lot of seating available and a decent pool table.  The main bartender/owner, Brandon, is just great.  He always has a smile, joke and a stiff drink for you - rain or shine.

The clientele is all over the map.  Local neighbors looking to unwind, eccentric whino regulars, Pool hustlers, Yuppie Marina girls/guys that feel too crowded in the local "classy joints" and yours truly.

The back patio is a great place for smokers year round (all kinds of smoke), as you can actually drink and enjoy that cigarette at the same time.  In the Summer is even better, very secluded.

I can't say enough good things about Brandon and his joint.  You gotta check it out, day or night, on your next trip to the Upper Haight.
author: Thomas W.

description:
I've never had a bad time at The Gold Cane. Back in the day, I spent A LOT of time here. I had just moved to SF, broken up with the boyfriend I moved here with, was broke, and in search of good times. Gold Cane to the rescue. I remember paying $3 for Ketel One and tonics. Sweet. I love the pool table, smoking section in the back, and jukebox. I also love one of the bartenders that always remembered me (and my Ketel One and tonics), even if it had been months since I had been there. 

The funniest part is that I ran into the ex boyfriend here about 2 years after we broke up. Small world (small city, actually).

The Gold Cane welcomed me to San Francisco (in a dysfunctional, "I drink too much" way) and for that I am grateful. I am also grateful that my heavy drinking days are long gone! It was fun while it lasted, but I am much healthier now!
author: Abby W.

description:
I usually really like this place, but yesterday 5 of us took our friend out for her 21st, we stopped in here for a drink and were ignored for 15 minutes by the bartender.
We left, and continued our crawl through Haight Street bars to friendlier territory.
author: Marz W.

description: I like bars with patios and Gold Cane has one! I've never sat inside, it looks kinda sad inside nothing special, but the patio is nice on a sunny day. They have Magners, Beer and Vodka, that's all I need :) But not all at once of course or it won't be pretty after :p
author: Karen T.

description: Good drinks, nothing really stood out for my friend and I here. As fellow yelpers yelp stiff drinks but I thought their prices were pretty standard..
author: Lisa W.

description:
i'm a fan of neighborhood bars, they have more character and less douche-baggery. 
rad patio, books available, pool table, a lot of space

Awesome staff, nothing but love for carrie!!
author: kiki b.

description:
First time here was meeting some friends for nighttime drinks.  They had a cool outdoor smoking area.  It was busy but not too busy, we still managed to find chairs, and it was easy ordering drinks.  There's a pool table and jukebox.  Both which seemed to be permanently occupied.

Second time was during the day.  After an afternoon shop down Haight we stopped in for some bloody marys.  Bartender was adorable guy who joked with us.  Cute place.
author: Mary R.

description: The Gold Cane is so cheap! It's kind of crazy that I get so excited about reasonably priced beer, but I do. GC is your typical dive, with good beers to drink on tap, but nothing else totally crazy to report.  I recommend if you are wanting a place to chill with pals and chat AND actually hear one another. Overall, good neighborhood bar, if you are in the hood.
author: Nichole P.

description:
I got stood up.  Again.  Which means that:
a) I'm a leper and therefore women are afraid of me.
b) I've lost my balls and the women whom I'm *supposed* to go on a date with don't dig chicks.
c) The women that have stood me up are still trapped under that heavy bookcase that fell on them just before the date, and they're still trying to reach the phone in order to call me to let me know that they won't make it.  

So it goes.  Third time i've been stood up in a very short amount of time.  So it goes that I once again sat at a bar (that was chosen by both parties involved!) and got shitfaced.  

*Singing to the tune of that dated yet still-classic Violent Femmes song "Kiss Off"*
I drank one one cuz you didn't show up 
Two two cuz this has to stop
Three Three for my anger
Four Four cuz I just had three
Five Five for tomorrow
Six Six cuz I'm already drunk

You get the idea.  I give up.  No more dating.  But, since the Gold Cane used to be a somewhat regular stop when I lived in that hood', at least I got drunk in comfortable surroundings and for quite cheap!  I always forget that they have a back patio for those rare yet great sunny days here in the city.  And for the three women who've stood me up recently....well...I have nothing to say about that.
author: Zev K.

description:
I had a really good time at this place during the haight street thang. Lots of fun people (a couple degenerates here and there) plenty of tree and plenty of sun and booze. 
Watch out for the Hippies.
author: Scott H.

description:
Love the cheap & decent drinks.

Love the super friendly bartenders, especially the one with the Irish accent.  Makes me want to him my grandpa.  

Love the huge moose hanging from the wall with lights around the antlers.  

Love the wide range of people in the bar ranging from a guy dressed straight from the 80's (think michael jackson's beat it music video) with bling-bling cz chandelier earrings to the polo shirt preppy type.
author: Sheryl S.

description:
Probably my favorite dive bar in the city.  For about two years I don't think they ever charged me the same amount for a drink (one week a GT was $3.50 then $2.85 and i think it is back around $3.50) and you never end up breaking the bank here.  Excellent music selection, quality patio for smoking/happy hour, and great tables so bring a deck of cards.

However, it may be time to get rid of the carpet.  If there is one recommendation I have for every bar owner it is no carpet.  Myself alone I have probably spilled over 20 drinks in that place and I don't want to know what else is permeating out of it at any given time....
author: Vince T.

description:
The Golden Cane is a great chill bar in the haight with cheap ass drinks and  sports trivia napkins.  The juke box ain't bad and it's a good place to come with a gang of friends to catch up and get plastered on the cheap

update: 
I love this place but I recently went there with a group of friends and one guy would not stop telling shit related stories from college
