there were like 5 stories, and  now I can't go back without  remembering the graphic details ( which I'll spare y'all). 

 But scatalogical stories aside, the mexican coffee is still an awesome deal and a great way to cap the evening
author: Harsh K.

description:
The Gold Cane is your quintessential dive/coke bar.  Drinks are cheap, atmosphere is there just to exist, and even when it's crowded, well, it's never really crowded.  Many regulars, and if you like to drink, and you're there often enough, then you'll eventually know them all by name, as they are friendly.  Bartenders are as well.  It's a total neighborhood bar for people who wish to ditch any place that is "a scene". 

The back outdoor patio area is useful.  If you're bored you can always grab a book off the bookshelf in back, play pool, or else find Money B's dad (Shock G's partner in crime from Digital Underground) at the bar.  For the price of a whiskey he'll tell you a story.
author: Shawn S.

description:
5 stars for the perfectly glorious, 'let's kill time on this sunny day of nothingness' afternoons passed at the Gold Cane. Far fewer stars would be given if you looked in as a tourist from Oklahoma walking down infamous H-A with your wife and kids.

However, when a local wants a drink and a patio and some instantly crazy conversation with some strangers (that later leads to a trip to the store to get meat, to the local house for a bbq, watching strangers trip, and then passing out from a full day of fun..) wow. I miss the days I had at the Cane. All three of them.
author: Lynn B.

description:
I love it.

VERY MUCH.

A bar. 

Whiskey and beer?  Do it.  Do it now.

This is a Bukowski type of den, and I think it is what any respecting person wants.... an atmosphere that keeps the lushes and tourists out.

Whiskey or Bourbon, you are set to enjoy this real, simple joint.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: The Gold Cane is a bar! I like the patio out back. I'm not a huge fan of The Haight, but this bar is fine for ... drinking beers and whatnot. Nothing special is going to happen here. The drinks are cheap.
author: Klevin D.

description: This place is more about plywood walls than gold canes but it's a fun neighborhood hangout for cheap drinks. Especially great on a random afternoon when the patio is open and some guys are jamming in the back. Nothing like sunshine, a cold beer and jams to put a smile on your face.
author: Steven H.

description:
I used to work at Cal-Surplus, which is a couple of doors down, and I would pop into the Cane at lunchtime on my way back from Balazo on an almost daily basis.  There is nothing like a cold shot of Rumple Minze to settle one of Balazo's ungodly big burritos.

The drinks are cheap and the bartenders are friendly.  If you get to know the bartenders and you tip well you will notice that the strength of your drink will rise and rise.  It's that kind of place.

I usually hate going to Haight-Ashbury and wading through all the 'wanna be' homeless kids, but this place is worth it.

The only time I avoid the Cane is on weekend nights when it can get REALLY crowded.
author: Mark G.

description:
This place really knows how to treat an alcoholic. About 150 years ago (The Eighties. Yikes!) when I worked at Buffalo Exchange, I would occasionally run over and have a quick 7+7 on my break. Fifteen minutes was long enough for two small but strong ones thanks to the attentive and accomodating bartenders.  Novelty napkins give you somewhere to direct your gaze so as not to interrupt others' quiet drinking.

Aaah, high school. Those were the days!

I imagine nothing's changed.
author: Teal H.

description:
A rather large outdoor patio in a rather wierd bar
nice days in san francisco..go enjoy some beer on the patio served by someone resembling your grandfather Dick. 
most other days in san francisco...avoid the gold cane.
author: Daniella B.

description: what can i say, the white feather(brendan) runs a tight ship and a great bar... a place to drink and shoot the breeze...
author: Reg B.

description: my favorite neighborhood dive bar. outdoor patio where you can chain smoke as well as drink (the best hot toddies!) I hate when we are told the patio is closing for the night.. its the saddest feeling...
author: Katie M.

description:
it's aight. it's not something special, it's not terrible either.  It didn't stink. there were plenty of spots for you to park it, and it serves good stiff drinks. Nice big patio out back for those nice SF days & nites.  

Can get pretty packed, the way the front door and the beginning of the bar hit..it's like a clusterfuck, and really annoying, otherwise, it's fine.  I wouldn't rush to go back there anytime soon, but it did the job. =)
author: Lulu C.

description:
Great Neighborhood bar. Cheap drinks and stiff drinks.  Lots of Regulars and everyone is friendly. Smoking in the Patio, and a good Juke box.  Pool table too.

A girl can go to this bar alone without being hassled and if hassled the bartenders will take care of you. The best neighborhood bar in the haight, once you go try it, you will be back.
author: Susie S.

description:
I live four blocks from this place. The crowd is fairly jockish or touristy. BUT. The well drinks are $3 all day, every day. The jukebox is shockingly good (Echo and the Bunnymen, Johnny Cash, The Clash, soul, funk, etc.) Not like WHOA AMAZING! good, but more like WHOAAAA, WAY BETTER THAN YOUD EXPECT! Back porch area is rad. Three tables. Upstairs and downstairs. 

You can be left to your own devices, or mingle if you choose. 

BASICALLY

Too many caps in this review, but if you're looking to hear decent music, get really fucked up on less than twenty bucks, and avoid going somewhere that you'd see anyone you know ...

this is the place. 

best local bar for Haight / Panhandle area
author: Cameron O.

description:
Reminds me of a boy I used to date who was damn cute...(thus the 4th star)
Supercheap drinks. An outdoor smoking area out back. Need I say more?

If you want to get really tanked and wake up half remembering what you got into the night before, then the Gold Cane is the place for you.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
One of the oldest bars on Haight St. The cheap prices reflect that. Come for the cheap beers and the smoking deck out back where you run into old neighborhood cats that tell stories of when Hendrix walked down Haight street. Sometimes there are people playing cliche 60's songs on guitar out back for singalongs. 

A little known aspect is that there is a bookshelf near the back that has books for the borrowing/trading.

The pool tables are decent. If you're looking to get a taste of current Haight flavor then this is the place to start and/or end your night.
author: Tim K.

description:
San Francisco has a reputation for friendly conversation between strangers, and nowhere have I experienced more of this than at the Gold Cane.  Sure, I can admit that at other places, when I find myself being avoided, it might have something to do with the feather boa and hot pants.  But to be fair, several of those times it was laundry day, and my good hot pants were in the wash.  

At the Gold Cane, there's always someone to talk to.  Oh, and they have cheap drinks, ample space to play pool, and a pretty good jukebox.
author: Sam M.

description:
So this place is a total five star place in my book. Here is why, one star for cool patrons, one star for strong drinks, one star for great go with the flow bartenders who will appreciate having a drink with you, one star for the great jukebox, one star for the patio. 

I'm out of stars or I would give another one for the large collection of books which you are welcome to read or another for the awesome family pictures above the myriad of liquor bottles.

So the last time I walk in, there is a group of pretty drunk Canadians in there. One of them was insistent in going behind the bar and making his own shot for his friends. The bartender at first was hesitant, but then agreed and so the very drunk happy Canadian, goes behind the bar, smiling ear to ear and happy to be on the other side. Takes an inordinate amount of time trying to make his drink, because he is drunk, chatting with me and my friends and his friends and the bartender and again because he is pretty drunk and doing little dances while making the shot. The whole bar was cracking up at his show and enjoyed the hell out of it.

By all means not an isolated event. You should go now. And message me. I might just join you and do my own little dances.
author: Fabian O.

description:
This was it.  My first bar in San Francisco, my first drink in San Francisco... it all started at The Gold Cane.

It was my first day in San Francisco, and by coincidence a college chum from the east coast was visiting at the same time.  Since I arrived in town in the afternoon, before the person I was staying with got home from work, I had some time to kill before I could get settled in.  So -- and this was before cell phones became ubiquitous, way back in the olden days -- I'd arranged to meet G. on Haight street.  He suggested the Gold Cane.

We couldn't have been more delighted with this complete dive bar.  Replete with neon beer signs, pool table with torn cover, and stinky patrons, we were in our element as we smoked cigarettes and sucked down cold ones in the dank bar while the California sun, new to both of us, blazed outside.
author: H.A. ..

description:
This bar has all the qualities that make it a 5 star establishment
 Cheap drinks
 Great bartenders
 Pool table
 Good jukebox (dont listen to the people that say otherwise)
 Nice patio
 NOT a pickup bar
 Jim Beam Rye
 Great clientele

And this last one is so key. Every time I'm here I meet some really cool open minded people. And theres always a good mix of people here from 19-59... If I lived closer, I would go more often, but as it stands its the only bar in the Haight I'll set foot in.
author: Andrew B.

description:
My favorite local drunk saloon.  I'll admit, there is nothing too exceptional about the gold cane; an outdated jukebox, unlevel pool table, and outdoor patio with cheap white chairs and tables, all contribute to this lackluster.

But there is something about the well seasoned bartenders and the cheap drinks--beers on tap as low as 2.50--attract a pleasant crowd.  You definitely don't have to worry about a girl screaming 'Oh my god', albeit you may hear echos of it from Hobbson Choice.  The pool table there attracts a decent school of sharks, i.e. dave and bobby.
author: John P.

description:
This was my first time.

Bartenders were responsive and not dicks.  There was plenty of space at the bar or in their seating area.  Music kept my interest and there were plenty of kinds of people to creep at:  a good time.
author: Ian T.

description:
My local Haight social club.
Not pretentious, neither is it a total shit hole.  what you see is what you get.

Bar delivers the wet stuff you need.
Interesting and outgoing crowd.
Decent pool table and a back yard patio for the smokers/ sun seekers.

Ultimately my essential local, but not a destination center.
author: david s.

description: I love this bar so much that I want to marry it and make drunk little babies. The drinks are cheap, no tourists, an awesome backyard for smokers and one time I met a dude on peyote. The end.
author: Jaime B.

description: This place makes strong drinks (+1), seems to attract at least one group of douchebags on any given night (-1). I want it to be my new local spot, but there's something about it that isn't quite right. Next time, I'll try the patio area now that the weather is a little warmer.
author: Lara C.

description:
Disclaimer alert: After having several drinks and tipping the obligatory $1.00 per drink, I received a free drink from the great barstaff.   

Wait, wasn't there a day when this was almost mandatory?  In an era of trendy bars with velour banquets, Reidel stemware, and Chihuly knockoffs adorning walls, I'm always amazed to find salt of the earth bars in San Francisco.  Thank god the Haight has a few for us lucky locals.  
Get yourself to this oasis of value drinks (I'm not cheap, dammit), local scenery (it is Haight Street after all) and one of the funnest bar scenes around.  From the college bar decor to persnickety local pool players, Gold Cane is one of the few bars around I'd still call authentic.
author: Nathan R.

description:
have i ever told you guys how much of an alcoholic i really am? well, just so you know, i can drink... a lot. and i love this place, cheap beer with cheap shots of cheap whiskey. i practically crawled outta that place.

their little outside patio area is awesome. i love being able to drink and smoke and conversate with people. oh and there was a dog the size of a horse the night i was there, or was i just seeing things? anyways, great dive bar.. must go back...
author: Manny M.

description: Where to drink in a glorious September day and hair of the dog from the previous evening's shenanigans involving a wig, purple hat, and only the most notorious Yelpers? If you can't get a reservation at Bar Amir's (he books up pretty quickly), the Gold Cane might do. They have a backyard with patio furniture from the 70s and make a mean cider. We had to bust a move when our turf was invaded by chode central.
author: Suzanne R.

description: Great dive bar to mingle outside, chain smoke and eat habanero stuffed olives or talk about "Brokeback Mountain" or get annoyed with my emo friends who are fucking cry babies and should grow a penis or listen to some old fart play his acoustic guitar while his hippie girlfriend sings along.  Everytime I come to this place, I never end up paying for my drinks, talk to tons of weirdos and I leave inebriated.
author: Christina S.

description: This place can appear kinda ghetto to the unschooled outsider, but that's because at the Gold Cane it's not about how you look or what you do, it's about serious drinking and serious good times. The back patio is great, but since it's impossible to get a seat out there when it's sunny, I prefer to go right before last call. Cheap, stiff drinks and a great window seat. Can't argue with that.
author: Megan W.

description: Locked in a staring contest with Martin Mack's, its across-the-street rival for least memorable bar in the Haight, Gold Cane mostly just reminded me of places I've already been (or maybe I've just been in San Francisco too long).  The large, red, overly-lit main room with more-than-ample table space?  Very Mad Dog in the Fog.  And that back patio gives me Bottom of the Hill deja vu.  It's not going to be the highlight of any pub crawls, but it's certainly a reliable place to {begin,end} the night, possibly whilst {wittily,incoherently} debating the merits of the (liberally strewn about) San Francisco Bay Guardian.
author: Wes M.

description: Here's the thing with bar hopping on the haight, you never know what you're going to get. I mean this about the denizens of any bar on the haight. Here are the facts: the drinks are from that great cocktail menu called the dive bar, they vary in strength and quality. The bartenders are generally quite friendly, the space is open and inviting including a fantabulous little back patio for smoking but as I said the crowd gets a little odd and off at times. I get the sense that those at the bar have been there since the Ford administration or before. I have some fond memories of this joint, but its never the first place I'll go to start a night, but I've ended plenty of them here.
author: Len S.

description: I judge people according to which bars they frequent. And I would not trust anyone who dislikes The Gold Cane. I love everything about this bar.
author: Brandy H.

description: AMAZING happy hour deal on Jack & Coke (4.50) + Nice patio area = a great time at Gold Cane. A nice place to relax with a drank in the Upper Height!
author: Haz O.

description: Where I used to go to lick my wounds after being kicked out of old-ownership Zam Zams is where I now go on nights where I don't want to match my earrings to my shoes or pay a ransom for a glass of wine. There is a bit of everything for everyone.
author: Gretchen T.

description: Perfect dive bar to go with a few friends to have some drinks and catch up. People leave you alone, the bartenders are friendly and competent, and it's not crowded. I was there a few weeks ago and I ordered my drink saying "May I please have..." and the bartender looked at me and said "May? The last time somebody used that word in here was May of last year!"
author: Suge K.

description: You'd never know it, but a half busy night at the Gold Cane with a half occupied back patio has the makings of miracles....and threesomes.  This place is frickin' magical.
author: Lindsay B.

description: Great little bar in the Haight.  It was raining out so my buddies and I ducked in while the girls shopped.  A couple beers later and you couldn't pry us away from the bar.  In fact, the girls wrapped up their shopping and joined us for some late afternoon libations.  What a cool little bar!  If only we had more bars like this in San Jose.  We ended up hanging out for several hours, lost track of time, and lost track of the fact that we were still in the Haight and had eight o'clock dinner reservations in North Beach.
author: David M.

description: Gold Cane is a old school bar. It has a harder crowd than most Haight Street bars. Less emo hipsters, more old hard drinkers, and bike messenger types. The place smells like piss and cigs even though you can't smoke or piss your pants here anymore--legally.
author: Johnny B.

description: Fun place to with a group of friends who don't want to deal with any kind of 'scene'.  good, cheap drinks, pool table, patio out back (you can even smoke back there if you want).  oh, and they have these cool napkins with trivia questions on them.  i love that.
author: Eileen H.

description: The Gold Cane lacks the pretense that so many SF bars have these days, and GOOD. The back patio is cooool. Pool tables, nice to have. It's all spread out nicely, easy going, affordable. Old Abe digs it.
author: Boom Z.

description: Hmmm...who knew the full name is Gold Cane Cocktail Lounge? I have mad eternal love for the GC. Not only is it the closest bar to my beloved childhood home, it also happens to be low low priced, homey and mercifully unpretentious in this often pretentious town. Ample seating on most nights + great--and functional--back patio = perfect place to go get embarrassingly sauced, on the cheap, on a Tuesday, with the consolation that most of your fellow patrons are wayyy more sauced than you.
author: Annie G.

description: Favorite bar in San Francisco. In one week, came to Gold Cane about 4 times. Cheap (and strong!) drinks, really nice bartenders, great outdoor patio lounge to drink and smoke ;) . Seriously, my boy got a tall glass of Guinness and I got a gin&tonic, both for $6! Needless to say, $20 got us drunk!! Cool environment, I loved the patio on top.
author: G G.

description: This is one of my favorite bars in San Francisco and I've lived here for 25 years. The well-drinks are some of the cheapest around, the place is not usually too crowded, and there are lots of tables and chairs. If you are sick of being crammed like sardines in a standing-room only, overpriced bar with a bunch of trendsters, this is the place to be. I hear the back porch is great for smoking various things as well, although I disavow any knowledge of such things. Let's just hope it doesn't end up like Zeitgeist and become ghetto-chic and overcrowded.
author: Rhys B.

description: DAMN CHEAP DRINKS!  Need not a happy hour at this place.  Every hour is a happy hour.  Yes the juke box sucks, and yes if you ever do get up to play at the pool table, you'd better lose or you're going to piss some local yocal off, but the quaint outdoor patio, and did I mention cheap drinks?  Make up for it.  Sometimes the bartenders can be a little bit moody, but isn't it that way at most bars?
author: Max M.

description: Some people think it smells like squirrels in here but I have to say it's a great place to spend a lazy Sunday afternoon.  The cocktails are stiff and cheap and there are always interesting folks to mingle with.  Cheers.
author: kat i.

description: Best bar in the Haight, and a decent bar all around.  Bring friends and chat at a table or go by yourself for the Newcastle on tap.
author: Blake B.

description: Duh! I've lived in the area forever and never went here. Take 3 parts old drunk men, two part hipster, a pinch of urban scum and garnish with a yuppie. Interesting mix, comfy, and we boozed up with three drinks for $9 bucks. I shall return often. Definitely a face in the gutter good time!
author: Dani D.

description: Hoorah! I had a great time at this place. The bartender was completely toasted but seeing how I was in the same state it all added up to a good time. My vodka tonic was vodka vodka since he poured my drink from two different vodka bottles. The outdoor patio is fabulous since you can sit in tables high above everyone else, look down, and scream "I'm the king of the world!". You know, if that's your thing.
author: Jane K.

description: Wonderful, low price cocktails 24-7, bartenders that say hello and care about you, a pool table, hi def TV's, and an friendly outside patio makes this place one of the best bars in the Haight.
author: Oren J.

description: Great local bar.....cheap drinks, laidback atmosphere, an outdoor patio, pool tables. What else do you need in a bar?
author: Barbs J.

description: So you say you suck at drinking but want to go to the Haight?  Then keep walking until you're inside Hobson's Choice.  The Cane is for people who can hold their booze and act human.  It doesn't have a pretentious theme and if you go often enough  you'll get to recognize the regulars and know who will try to talk to you for 3 hours or who will just smile and say hello.  It also has a patio.  A PATIO IN THE HAIGHT.  Genius people.
author: Jess H.

description: I'm just saying....don't advertise the World Cup when you're not going to play the sound of the game in the bar!  The outside windows are all painted with advertisements for WORLD CUP 2010, yet the bartender refused to turn on the sound of the USA v. England match, despite the fact that everyone was asking for it.  Instead he played depressing music.  Dude, you could have pulled in a lot more tips and earned some life-long customers if you had just played the game sound!!  Surrounding bars were simply too crowded, but I guarantee some of those people would come to your place to spend money, if only you were welcoming and accommodating!
author: Jennifer M.

description: Stiff, cheap drinks, and they used to, at least, have a really amazingly cute girl bartender.  Definitely a good place to hit when you're not interested in the other Haight bar crowds, like Hobson's Choice (like, ohmygawd!).
author: Patrick B.

description: I used to be able to be found here almost any day of the week about 5 years ago.  Still it is my favorite place on Upper-Haight which usually isn't saying that much.  It's been around forever and Brendan is about the coolest guy in town...You definitely feel like family in there if you can handle the Haight street peeps giving you pirate talk!  I love to chill in the back and watch the madness!
author: Daniel Q.

description: This place doesn't mess around. They want you to crawl out of this place with your stomach pumped with stiff whiskey, the full essence of a dive. The only thing that isn't extremely divey about the place is the fact that the bartenders here are some of the friendliest in town. CHECK IT.
author: Tosh J.

description: Awesome divey bar with a great cross section of locals and newbies to the neighborhood. It is like a liquor infused sanctuary, an oasis if you will, in the heart of the bustling Upper Haight, which I usually boycott because you can barely walk down the sidewalks this time of year. However, the cockails and beers are awesomely afforable and the bartenders are usually fairly nice. There's a backyard that you can smoke in and chat with locals who've been coming there for ages. I still run into some of those cats! They have a pool table and I thought I saw some darts there too!
author: Gina R.

description:
Ahh The Gold Cane. Who carries a gold cane you might ask? Well, someone with a lot of style and class but who also says I don't give a f about you newfangled kids and your hygiene and whatnot.

The Gold Cane:

- has a comfortable layer of grime from years of use. (but they just got new carpets what what)
- makes wonderful drinks but also has solid beers on tap
- always has a semblance of a crowd but is never overly crowded
- has bar napkins with geography and tv trivia from the 1970's
- Has tables full of old business cards, including a certain not to be named friend of ours... heh heh.
- Has a back patio, so that you can invite a crazy lady to sit with you because everyone thought she was someone else's friend.
- has a pool table. But you won't be playing it, because there is always the hardest core game of billiards going down. Always.
- Jukebox, check
- Bartenders who don't look like they want to kill themselves.

yay!
author: Karen J.

description: Walked by this place a million times and never noticed it. I ended up going there to play euchre. Right when we got there all psyched to play cards the power went out on the entire block (big rainstorm). We were all bummed out but the bartender did not miss a beat. He did some trick with his flashlight that lit the bar area pretty well. They brought us a bunch of candles. And between everyone's phones, lights, and the candles we played through the power cut. Also managed great and speedy service with the drinks despite no power. Great prices as well, and when the power came back, they were playing good music too (soul).
author: Vivek S.

description: you can actually dance here if you are so inclined done it many times...also, the yelper below mentioned you can wrap yourself in a blanket if you are cold outside...go ahead, wrap yourself in a blanket--although you might be accused of being homeless....just sayin'.....
author: B F.

description: I love the Gold Cane.  Brendan is the friendliest bartender in town, and the Cane is on of the least pretentious dive bars in the city.  It occasionally attracts some dodgy folks, but it's always a nice place!
author: Nick A.

description: This is what Cheers would be like if it were based in San Francisco, except the Gold Cane is much more hip and caters to a wider ethnic group. The friendly Irish staff serves up cheap, stiff drinks, and I guarantee the juke box has at least one song that will make you want to order a second round. They have a killer outdoor patio and they even offer a free book exchange. I once spent an entire season of Monday Night Football here because they had $3 rolling rock's and free footlong hot dogs. Admittedly, the regulars can be a bit salty if you hit this spot during the week, I've always had a good time here. This place is so cool, it almost makes me forgot about the teenagers outside that are begging for change as they toke on a joint.....almost.
author: Michael H.

description: One of the oldest joints on the block. It used to be in the Club Deluxe spot, but they had to move to their current location because the floor rotted out. The owner is a great local and is in that old sepia picture he has hanging on the wall. He's the boy standing off behind the bartender, his dad.
author: Babs P.

description: This is a no frills watering hole.  Getting a table is no problem, good mix (price and quality-wise) of beers on tap, and a mostly young crowd the Friday night I went there.
author: Laura K.

description: Used to go here when I lived in the Haight and frequented the bowling alley, which is now a record store. This bar is for professionals only. I went there about a year ago with my ex after breakfasting at the Pork Store. We went there at, oh maybe 10am...we drank with the bartender and some old timer from Murios. The back patio was treating us well. All of the sudden the bartender was off & drinking with us and all our drinks were free! The next bartender decided he needed shots of Jameson every 15 minutes so we didn't want to be rude. Then it was about midnight and the boy & I got into a nasty spat. He called me at 2am from a hotel on Lombard. I have no idea how he got there, I recall an ugly muni ride and one hell of a hangover, but it was a blast!
author: Colleen B.

description: Nice place to visit, better to have shots with the bartender and a stranger while waiting for a friend. Liking the arm stretch availability whilst playing pool against a wide asort of folks, plus one Golden Cane!
author: Daniel M.

description: this is a great mellow bar. perfect for having a drink and conversation. drinks are cheap and in the heavy pour category. awesome back patio smoking area with seating. it is cash only so make sure to bring some paper monies.
author: Joseph N.

description: Great multi-level patio area in the back! Decent beer selection. They also were very cool about my old 420 buddies and I filling said back patio with non-cigarette smoke.
author: Melissa L.

description: I love a place where I can sit at the bar and get drunk with the bartenders.  Especially when the drinks don't cost anything.  But when they do, who cares?  $3 taps!
author: Rachel N.

description: No thrills other than their Fantastic Stiff Cheap drinks (which is a HUGE thrill for me).  Fun for people watching too; very upper haight :)  Just go.
author: Marla L.

description: A good, cheap dive bar in the Haight with a small outdoor space.  That's 4 stars right there.  Every neighborhood needs a place for the locals to go, knock back a few drinks that don't break the bank, and then stumble home.  The Haight has several of these joints, but if you are looking for bang for your buck, the Gold Cane is the place.
author: Blake W.

description: One of my original haunts when I first moved to the city in 2004, & still one of my favorite fall-back options for when you want to meet friends out somewhere without making it in to a big production. One of the city's better & cheaper dives. And you're pretty much guaranteed to meet some interesting characters mulling about on Haight late at night when you leave.
author: Pete J.

description: How fun, especially when you hit it up while the Haight St festival is going on right outside the front door.  In the back there is an outdoor area which is open, peaceful and full of chill people.  I didn't even bother with the indoor bar area because it was a sunny and beautiful San Francisco Sunday.  All of the patrons were boozing draft beers from the outside bar and the scene even included guitar playing and hippies frolicking.  There was a large crowd on the streets but the bar never felt too crowded.  What a fun place.
author: Michelle N.

description:
after a disappointing stop at martin mack's, my friend and i happened across the gold cane.  we had passed it a couple times but hadn't gone in since the windows were a little tinted and we couldn't see in.  finally, we just chanced it and walked through the doors.

we sat at the bar and were helped almost immediately.  the bartender made us strong drinks and made them on the counter (as opposed to martin mack's) so we could see the alcohol to soda ratio.  the bartender was also very chatty and nice.  he even did a shot with us and gave us our lemon drops on the house!

i would definitely recommend this place because of good/strong drinks, friendly and fast service, good atmosphere seating at the bar, clean restrooms, clean place in general and convenient location when walking around haight.
author: Lily B.

description: It's really an average dive bar.  It's got a mixed crowd. I, I, I just don't know what else to say about this place.  It's a good place to go when you don't know where to go, but want to avoid the tendernob and marina.
author: Angie C.

description:
great bar.  great jukebox.  great drinks.  stiff drinks.  good people.  outdoor patio.  pool table.  stiff drinks. 

I have come here to drown my sorrows, grade papers, meet friends, avoid haight street, and eat dinner (they sell the best potoato chips around).  This bar is of a dying breed in San Francisco.  Friendly bartenders, friendly patrons.  I love this place.
author: Charley B.

description: Scrabble on the television, free books, simple patio out in the back, and it's open at noon.
author: Pelle Y.

description: check out my review for delirium. I told you I do like dive bars. My best friend lives in the Haight so I'm always there. And whenever we are just hanging out and dint want to go drink in the hustle and bustle of the city. We go to the cane. The cheapest drink in SF I've found. The bartender is hella nice. Cash only kinda sucks but 20 dollars can get you fucked up beyond reproach.
author: Chris L.

description: I really like this place. The bartenders are very friendly and the drinks are always made with care (I like getting a shamrock in my Guinness). The Gold Cane is a good size for a bar. I'm not really impressed with the jukebox nor the tv's (I need my HD). This place seems to be a holdout of traditional working class bars in the haight. I always feel comfortable here and will keep coming back.
author: D J.

description: This is a very laid back place. It has a ton of seating, pool tables, TVs playing the current sports games, and a back patio. I never felt crowded and the drinks were cheap which is always nice. Definitely a good place to hang out with a big group of friends.
author: Carly W.

description: The Gold Cane rocks my world. it's a perfect place to pass a rare sunny afternoon in the Haight -- the drinks are strong and the outside patio area is definitely the draw. it also has a great local, neighborhoody feel to it -- i always meet the coolest random people there and we usually end up talking about how much we love CA/San Fran/the Haight for extensive periods of time while chain-smoking. good times. also, the irish bartender (/owner?) is sooo nice and friendly, he only adds to the inviting, comfortable atmosphere.
author: Meredith M.

description: such a fun dive in the Haight. Haven't been there in some time... but it has always been a favorite, along with Nikki's BBQ. Just a great place to get a drink and enjoy the parade of characters waltzing in & out of the Cane. Check it out.
author: Steven G.

description: Don't know why I don't come here more often.  Drinks are $4 bucks for call drinks, I think $3 for well drinks - and I don't remember the last time I paid that little for a drink that actually tasted like there is liquor in it.  There's a pool table and the bathrooms are CLEAN.  What more can a girl ask for in a bar???
author: Luba M.

description: My favorite dive bar on Haight Street!  You will find a hodge podge of interesting folks here, never boring.  It also has a great outside smoking patio which I love and is rare in the Haight.  A pitcher of Sierra goes for $10, a great price.  I highly recommend this place for a low key evening.
author: Joy W.

description: This is a great shitty dive bar. Wells are always three bucks, and they have a patio you can smoke on out back. Like everyone else, I have to agree the drinks are extremely strong. Great place to get wasted on the cheap.
author: osmahn k.

description:
This place is my favorite bar in my new neighborhood.

Cheap drinks, nice employees, and plenty of dirty hippies and weirdos to entertain you while you hang out. The outside patio is rather small, but open late and a great place to chill. Today (during the haight st fair) they even opened up a larger portion of the patio and stuck a bar out there too. Perfect place to hang on a sunny day
author: Matt C.

description: what the F are you guys smokin??? I guess maybe crack since it's the Haight...but this place sucks. dirty, worst service ever! How about hiring bartenders that don't wear hearing aids? The last thing I want to do at a bar is wait around for some 90+ yr old grandpa to come waddle his way over to me with his walker and judgmental eyes. Service was HORRIBLE. Not sure if he was racist ( i don't wan to pull the racist card) or he just didn't like my style, or maybe he was just mad because he's still working a dead end job when he should be in some retirement home on the quiet side of town...but this old MFer was super rude. I honestly tried to be nice...but after he threw a sh*t fit I just gave up...90+yrs didn't change him...how could I?
author: Chi Y.

description:
This place smells like bum b.o. and dirty ass.  Normally when a place smells bad you eventually habituate to the smell, but there were so many different rotten odors, every time I readjusted I was assaulted by some nasty stank.

There was also a lack of women situation.  There were a couple of beat up looking, possibly ex-hookers, putting black sabbath on the jukebox.  They looked like the people I see milling around outside of the residential hotels on 16th street in the Mission.

Basically, I'm willing to spend an extra dollar on my drink, not to hang out in a place that smells like a dirty locker room.

I will say though - that the bartender was really nice, and the service was quick.  I guess when there are no cute girls at the bar, jockeying for the bartenders attention, I get served faster.
author: Greg S.

description: Places like this are becoming perilously rare in San Francisco: a good, fun bar, not too expensive, good juke box, and a diverse mix of people, young and old.  If you call this a 'dive bar,' then I'm pretty sure you've never been to one.
author: V. M.

description:
The Gold cane is a wonderful terrible place where San Francisco's numerous galaxies could possibly collide, a terrible mix-mash of all the variety haightstreet has to offer and assembling it into a san Franciscan version of the bar from star wars where Grido got shot.for real other than that the place is filled with numerous urban cougars and incorrigible alcoholics and forty-somethings that need to talk about their divorce and why their ex hates them or why their ex should die..you will very likely be asked for your uninformed opinion about this.
i have spent way too many hours , way too many dollars, and way too many black-outs at this dirty watering hole that i really should never ever go there again. unfortunately my close friend machete mike is pretty much a fixed piece of furniture there and the only way i can actually aver see him is when his ass is parked on one of them stools on his way to Haight Ashbury institutional fame..he'll be in lonely planet one day i tell thee.
The main perk for the place is that the Bartenders are down to earth friendly and nice.a okay..they haven't kicked me out once.
author: vince d.

description: I lived in the Haight for 5 years and for some reason this bar was always my favorite.  Maybe it was the cheap drinks.  Perhaps it was the surly patrons.  Or it could be that it was the closest bar to my house.  Regardless, this nondescript, no atmosphere, hole in the wall is what every neighborhood dive strives to be.  If you have some loose change in your pocket and just want to sit at the bar and shoot the shit with complete strangers, with strange tales, this is the spot.
author: Robert G.

description: Take a toke, have a smoke, and stay for a beer, what else is there to say...it is how bars are supposed to be, a place to relax, meet new peeps and get tore up with your friends all in the friendly confines of an outdoor patio.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
One of the only places in the Haight I can really say I can enjoy, the Gold Cane is a rarity in the Haight.

I say rarity because despite the commercialization and the yuppification of the Haight, the Golden Cane strikes me as a genuine local bar.  It has tenacious barflies, laidback bartenders, and an interior that is reminiscent of an older, less trendy Haight.  Although there are other enduring bars in the Haight, like the Trophy Room, the Gold Cane avoids the twin pitfalls of the tourists and the deadbeats.

I admit that I only drink at the Cane when I'm in the Haight(twice a month or so), but I have yet to have a bad experience there.  If I was more of a local, there might be five stars instead of four, but I honestly don't know the scene enough to bump it up.
author: John B.

description: Ahhhh..... the Gold Cane. The good ol' local dive bar, where any given night is like an episode of Cheers. You always see familiar faces, learn the names of the bartenders (and owner, who usually works weekends) and they learn yours. They want to know all about you and will chat and tell jokes. Good stuff. The pool table is usually loaded with regulars, and they all know each other well. You'll usually find a dice game going on somewhere in the bar, too. There is ample seating space inside, which makes it great for groups to just hang out and have a cheap beer.  There's a cozy little back patio (which closes pretty early b/c of the neighbors' noise complaints) but there is a random mix of people at the bar and music on the jukebox, and an assortment of drink options. Shots are usually the basics, but the beer selection is decent (and did I mention CHEAP?!). Don't expect anything trendy or pretentious at this dive bar, but do expect a relaxing, chill place to hang out and actually chat over cheap drinks. My "home" bar. :) The only complaint I ever have is the odd smell that always hits me in the face upon entering the Cane. Luckily, you get used to it.
author: Stephanie B.

description: a good, unpretentious bar. not a pickup joint, no DJ, no sake drinks. beer, pool table, back patio, nice bartenders. when all you want to do is have a beer and hangout, this will do nicely.
author: Tom H.

description: i love this bar. cheap drinks. awesome bartenders and a 420 friendly patio! i could barely stumble home last night.  always my favorite place in the haight.
author: people l.

description:
I've been popping into the Gold Cane on and off since the early nineties , and to be fair it's always been Ok .
Nothing really special , but they have always managed to be one of the few bars in the neighborhood that wasn't full of idiots or people doing a drug deal .
Thats why it was so disappointing to go in there a couple of nights ago and find that the current bartender was a complete asshole.....
Right off the bat he had a shitty attitude , to the point where we didn't even manage to get our drinks order filled before some of the people I was with decided to go somewhere else because of his "vibe" 
( It's the guy with the pony tail and the beard , in case you happen to be looking through the window and be considering going there or , say Zam Zam , up the street )
But bartenders come and go , so I forgive the Gold Cane , and It'll probably be OK again when this guy is fired .
Soon hopefully .
Dick .
author: j b.

description: i guess i may be revealing a little much about my love for dive bars. what can i say?  they're like a crutch.   a cane, if you will?
author: regina k.

description: thanks to big man B-  this is my new favorite watering hole in the city.  can you believe that there are still $4 buck premium drinks around?!!!!  what the %$#@.  couldn't believe it until i set foot in the place.  better yet...no happy hour! y ou can drink all day at the same price.
author: Jaclyn L.

description: oh gold cane.you used to be my haight street standard that made me feel ok about being on haight street(LOATHE THE HAIGHT).last night me and my buddy Dan went there for old times sake,and I don;t know if it was burning man trickle over but I was wishing for a shot gun in order to murder everyone in the back patio.they also took out the touch screen game machine which is my reason for life.drinks were not as stiff as I remembered them to be.some guy kept asking me if i wanted to dance and do LSD,that was interesting
author: Lauren V.

description: An ideal place to go with a group of friends. Inexpensive drinks.  The only con is that it should take credit cards.  Whenever I come here, I end up doing Fernet shots with the father of Digital Underground's Money B.
author: Marko C.
